167975.name: Opération Commando: Pegasus Bridge
167975.description:
(Version française ci-dessous.)

In 1944, during the night of 5th to 6th June, paratroopers of the British 6th Airborne achieved three heroic missions that made possible the D-Day Normandy Landings on the East sector (Gold, Juno and Sword beaches).
In Operation Commando - Pegasus Bridge, one player leads the English commandos, while his opponent is in charge of the defending German troops.

Each turn, on a different battlefield (each ground having specific characteristics), players draw cards (each player has his own deck), can play events, and then an assault begins. The German plays a unit; the English answers with a unit, that must have a Combat value equal or higher than the German unit's, or reach it thanks to boosts. If it does, the German can boost his unit, then the English, and so on until a player stops. A unit's combat value can be raised by combat action cards and tokens (one side +1 Combat, one blank side) taken from the player's tokens reserve and flipped.
If the English's unit is destroyed, he loses one of his 3 Manpower Points (MP) but moves to the next ground (the assault ends, as does the turn on this ground). If the German's unit is destroyed, he can play another one (depending on the ground's size) and the assault goes on. If the English destroys all enemy units present on the ground, he wins the assault and progresses without losing a MP.

Players also have a pool of special cards, the powerful "heroic" cards, from which they secretely choose one card to add to their hand each two turns. Since heroic cards have potent effects and can't be countered, choosing them well depending on the situation of the game is strategically very important. These cards feature actual historical officers and events.

The game contains three scenarios, each of which corresponding to one of the three missions that the English commandos had to fulfill this night: the taking of the bridge of Bénouville ("Pegasus Bridge") to allow the landed troops to progress deeper inside the land; the assault on the Merville Gun Battery, a fortified area threatening the Landind beaches with long distance cannons; and the bombing of the bridges on the Dives river to prevent the tanks of the 21th Panzer Division from reinforcing the German troops. Each scenario has its own pool of cards (including heroic cards) and different gameplays.

To win, the English must fulfill his objective (which depends of the scenario), by winning the assault on one or more objective grounds. To win, the German has to prevent the English to reach his goal, generally by bringing his Manpower Points to zero or, in the Dives scenario, by preventing him to destroy two bridges out of four.

The three scenarios can be played in campaign mode (one after the other) to recreate the historic night. Depending on his results, the English gets more or less campaign points, and when the three scenarios have been played, his total score indicates if the D-Day Landing will be possible or not.

The 120 artworks illustrating the cards are realistic and faithful to historical documents (uniforms, weapons, locations...)

---

En 1944, pendant la nuit du 5 au 6 juin, les parachutistes de la 6e Division Aéroportée Britannique ("6th Airborne") accomplirent trois missions héroïques qui permirent au Débarquement d'avoir lieu sur le secteur est (plages Gold, Juno et Sword).
Dans **Opération Commando - Pegasus Bridge**, l'un des joueurs dirige les commandos anglais, et son adversaire les troupes allemandes.

À chaque tour, sur un champ de bataille différent (chaque terrain possédant des caractéristiques spécifiques), les joueurs piochent des cartes (chacun a sa propre pioche), peuvent jouer des événements, puis un assaut commence. L'Allemand joue une unité ; l'Anglais répond par une unité, qui doit avoir une valeur de combat égale ou supérieure à celle de l'unité allemande, ou l'atteindre grâce à des bonus. Si c'est le cas, l'Allemand peut renforcer son unité, puis l'Anglais peut faire de même, et ainsi de suite jusqu'à ce qu'un joueur renonce. La valeur de combat d'une unité peut être augmentée grâce à des actions de combat et des jetons (avec une face +1 et une face sans bonus) pris dans la réserve du joueur et jetés en l'air comme un pile ou face.
Si l'unité de l'Anglais est détruite, il perd l'un de ses 3 Points d'Effectifs (PE) mais avance jusqu'au prochain terrain (l'assaut se termine, de même que le tour sur ce terrain). Si c'est l'unité de l'Allemand qui est détruite, ce dernier peut en jouer une autre (selon la taille du terrain) et l'assaut se poursuit. Si l'Anglais élimine toutes les unités ennemies présentes, il remporte l'assaut et progresse sans perdre de PE.

Les joueurs disposent également d'une réserve de cartes spéciales, les puissantes cartes "héroïques", réserve dans laquelle ils choisissent secrètement une carte qu'ils ajoutent à leur main tous les deux tours. Les cartes héroïques ayant des effets puissants et ne pouvant être annulées, bien les choisir en fonction du déroulement de la partie est stratégiquement très important. Ces cartes représentent des officiers ayant réellement pris part aux opérations et des événements s'étant effectivement produits.

Le jeu propose trois scénarios, chacun d'eux correspondant à l'une des trois missions que les commandos anglais devaient accomplir cette nuit-là : la prise du pont de Bénouville ("Pegasus Bridge") pour permettre aux troupes débarquées de progresser à l'intérieur des terres ; l'assaut sur la batterie de Merville, une zone fortifiée menaçant les plages du Débarquement avec des canons à longue portée ; et la destruction des ponts sur la rivière Dives pour empêcher les blindés de la 21e Panzer Division de venir renforcer les troupes allemandes. Chaque scénario possède ses propres cartes (dont les cartes héroïques) et des mécaniques de jeu différentes.

Pour gagner, l'Anglais doit remplir sa mission (qui dépend du scénario), en remportant l'assaut sur un ou plusieurs terrains objectifs. Pour gagner, l'Allemand doit empêcher l'Anglais d'atteindre son but, généralement en lui faisant perdre tous ses Points d'Effectifs, ou, dans le scénario de la Dives, en l'empêchant de détruire deux des quatre ponts.

Les trois scénarios peuvent être joués à la suite, en mode "campagne", pour recréer cette nuit historique. En fonction de ses résultats, l'Anglais obtient plus ou moins de points de campagne, et quand les trois scénarios ont été joués, son score total indique si le Débarquement sur les plages de Gold, Juno et Sword pourra avoir lieu ou non.

Les 120 illustrations de cartes sont réalistes et fidèles aux documents historiques (uniformes, armes, lieux...)

167976.name: Malifaux: Arsenal Box – Outcasts (Wave 1)
167976.description: We're entering a new world of hurt and this box contains all the guns, swords , and brutality you will need for you to survive your next fight. Inside, you will find every single stat and upgrade card for Outcasts featured in the second edition book. Now fight for your spot at the top of this twisted food chain.

167977.name: Malifaux: Arsenal Box – Gremlins (Wave 1)
167977.description: We're entering a new world of hurt and this box contains all the guns, swords , and brutality you will need for you to survive your next fight. Inside, you will find every single stat and upgrade card for Gremlins featured in the second edition book. Now fight for your spot at the top of this twisted food chain.

167978.name: Malifaux: Arsenal Box – Ten Thunders (Wave 1)
167978.description: We're entering a new world of hurt and this box contains all the guns, swords , and brutality you will need for you to survive your next fight. Inside, you will find every single stat and upgrade card for Ten Thunders featured in the second edition book. Now fight for your spot at the top of this twisted food chain.

167979.name: The Camp Bloodshed Trilogy: Part One
167979.description:
From publisher blurb:

Camp Bastion is ready for its grand opening. Everything is in place -- the counselors are there, fun activities are planned and the campers have just arrived. Oh, and there's a deranged killer on the loose. Everyone at the site is in grave danger as they are stalked and picked off, one by one. Who will survive? Why has this relentless psycho descended upon the camp? How can he be stopped?

The Camp Bloodshed Trilogy (Part One) is the first of three flicks (aka adventures) that collectively represent a trilogy of movies. It all begins right here! And wait 'til you see the "twist" ending!

167980.name: Malifaux: Arsenal Box – Guild (Wave 2)
167980.description: The fate of Malifaux is approaching a crossroads. Forces continue to vie for power, as new allies join the struggle. Contained in this Arsenal Deck you will find all the stat and upgrade cards needed to play the Guild characters and crews found in the Malifaux 2E: Crossroads book.

167981.name: Malifaux: Arsenal Box – Resurrectionists (Wave 1)
167981.description: The fate of Malifaux is approaching a crossroads. Forces continue to vie for power, as new allies join the struggle. Contained in this Arsenal Deck you will find all the stat and upgrade cards needed to play the Guild characters and crews found in the Malifaux 2E: Crossroads book.

167982.name: Malifaux: Arsenal Box – Arcanists (Wave 2)
167982.description: The fate of Malifaux is approaching a crossroads. Forces continue to vie for power, as new allies join the struggle. Contained in this Arsenal Deck you will find all the stat and upgrade cards needed to play the Guild characters and crews found in the Malifaux 2E: Crossroads book.

167983.name: Megacities of Neo Neo
167983.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Grand Stair stretches behind the scenes of the multiverse,
The Doors upon its unfathomably vast span leading the way to gossamer worlds of limitless variety and infinite possibility. On these myriad worlds there are cities, and then there are cities. These are the latter.

Megacities of Neo Neo is an ultramodern realm of sprawling cityscapes and technologically overstimulated masses, foreshadowing what might happen to a world when an unchecked Eidolon builds and crystalizes reality too well for too long. Visit the Sen-Zaibatsu Arcology! Commission a VR-controlled remote duplicant! Enslave yourself on the MegaWeb! Greedy, globe-spanning omnicorporations dominate the planet, commercializing and data-tracking every kernel of human existence, leaving the underdog Umbra and its revolutionary agents as the last, best hopes to shake up the system. In the streets the people cry - NEO NEO! - demanding to scrap this future and begin anew.

167984.name: Malifaux: Arsenal Box – Outcasts (Wave 2)
167984.description: The fate of Malifaux is approaching a crossroads. Forces continue to vie for power, as new allies join the struggle. Contained in this Arsenal Deck you will find all the stat and upgrade cards needed to play the Guild characters and crews found in the Malifaux 2E: Crossroads book.

167985.name: Malifaux: Arsenal Box – Neverborn (Wave 2)
167985.description: The fate of Malifaux is approaching a crossroads. Forces continue to vie for power, as new allies join the struggle. Contained in this Arsenal Deck you will find all the stat and upgrade cards needed to play the Guild characters and crews found in the Malifaux 2E: Crossroads book.

167986.name: Malifaux: Arsenal Box – Gremlin (Wave 2)
167986.description: The fate of Malifaux is approaching a crossroads. Forces continue to vie for power, as new allies join the struggle. Contained in this Arsenal Deck you will find all the stat and upgrade cards needed to play the Guild characters and crews found in the Malifaux 2E: Crossroads book.

167987.name: Malifaux: Arsenal Box – Ten Thunders (Wave 2)
167987.description: The fate of Malifaux is approaching a crossroads. Forces continue to vie for power, as new allies join the struggle. Contained in this Arsenal Deck you will find all the stat and upgrade cards needed to play the Guild characters and crews found in the Malifaux 2E: Crossroads book.

167988.description:
Crossroads is the newest addition to the Malifaux universe. This book contains rules for nearly two hundred models which have been updated to second edition or added to the line. It also contains a massive amount of new stories further exploring the characters of Malifaux and the roles they play in the lore. Everyone who enjoys Malifaux will find something they love about this book!

It clocks in at 320 pages and includes rules for all crews which have not yet been updated to second edition, along with a few new ones. Each chapter is divided up by faction containing a series of short stories, one for every Master in the faction. In this way, every master in the book gets some face time and none are left sitting on the bench! Finally, every story has a special scenario tied to it, allowing you to relive the trials and tribulations of some of your favorite characters.
167988.name: Malifaux: Crossroads

167989.description:
Expansion contains three additional cards with elements common with Pick-a-Dog and Pick-a-Polar Bear games. As those cards are rare and hard to match with other cards from the base game, players get more (2 or 3) points for them.

The fourth card contains instruction with illustration of all cards matching with the expansion.

This expansion was published as a promo for the SPIEL 2013. Fair's name and date is printed on the instruction card.
167989.name: Pick-a-Dog: Polar Bear Expansion

167990.description:
Black Diamond is the largest mercenary force in the universe. Originally created to manage the disparate private Security Charters, Black Diamond has become increasingly centralized and cohesive. It now maintains a force to rival any of the most powerful organizations in the Last Galaxy. Leopold Magnus spearheads Black Diamond's research and development. Naturally the best place to test his fiendish creations is on the field of battle.

Featuring a playable force straight out of the box, mini-rulebook with complete game rules, an esper deck, and tons of tokens; this starter box is the perfect way to jump straight into the Relic Knights tabletop miniatures game!
167990.name: Relic Knights: Black Diamond Battle Box

167991.description:
Cerci Speed Circuit is not just a race track, but an entire planet given over to the speed and thrill of the race. With the onset of the Darkspace Calamity, these risktakers and daredevils must learn to use their skills to defend the universe from destruction.

Featuring a playable force straight out of the box, mini-rulebook with complete game rules, an esper deck, and tons of tokens; this starter box is the perfect way to jump straight into the Relic Knights tabletop miniatures game!
167991.name: Relic Knights: Cerci Speed Circuit Battle Box

167992.description:
The Doctrine has long studied the harnessing and manipulation of Esper. Their prestigious academies have trained the greatest scholars, sages, and mystics the universe has ever known. If the Darkspace Calamity is to be stopped, the Doctrine's knowledge and skill will be of paramount importance, and its students will be challenged as never before.

Featuring a playable force straight out of the box, mini-rulebook with complete game rules, an esper deck, and tons of tokens; this starter box is the perfect way to jump straight into the Relic Knights tabletop miniatures game!
167992.name: Relic Knights: Doctrine Battle Box

167993.name: Flat Cube
167993.description:
Flat Cube is a solo card game consisting of six cards with a picture of half a coloured cube on each side, which will form a whole cube when placed next to the correct side of another card.

The player shuffles the cards then places them face up in a row. The aim of the game is to make all the cards line up with matching cubes (except for the two on either end, which will only match on one side).

In order to do this, the player must pull two (and only two) side-by-side cards out from the row and move them to an available slot — either on one end or in a space created by moving two previous cards. Continue doing this until the objective is complete, leaving no spaces and moving only two cards at any one time.

167994.description:
The Noh Empire has terrorized the stars and haunted the nightmares of the universe's sentient species since time immemorial. Their Dragon Fleets reap souls and slaves to feed the Endless Hunger of their Hydra God, Nozuki. As Nozuki's High Priestess, Zineda fulfills the terrible God's commands and prophecies with merciless relish. Those forced to face the Noh in battle pray to die in battle. To be captured alive is a fate worse than death.

Featuring a playable force straight out of the box, mini-rulebook with complete game rules, an esper deck, and tons of tokens; this starter box is the perfect way to jump straight into the Relic Knights tabletop miniatures game!
167994.name: Relic Knights: Noh Empire Battle Box

167995.description:
The paladins of the Shattered Sword have stood as a bulwark defending the Alliance for millenia. The Darkspace Calamity has seen this gallant organization spread thin throughout the stars in a bid to stem the encroaching chaos.

Featuring a playable force straight out of the box, mini-rulebook with complete game rules, an esper deck, and tons of tokens; this starter box is the perfect way to jump straight into the Relic Knights tabletop miniatures game!
167995.name: Relic Knights: Shattered Sword Battle Box

167996.description:
The chaos and anarchy caused by the Darkspace Calamity has created the perfect environment for piracy. Yet as the Star Nebula Corsairs plunder and grow wealthy off of the fleeing refugees, even they cannot help but wonder if the Calamity is boon or bane. Captain Harker has made it his life's work to discover the cause of the calamity, but when he discovers it will it be to stop it or merely to profit?

Featuring a playable force straight out of the box, mini-rulebook with complete game rules, an esper deck, and tons of tokens; this starter box is the perfect way to jump straight into the Relic Knights tabletop miniatures game!
167996.name: Relic Knights: Star Nebula Corsairs Battle Box

167997.name: Life in the West
167997.description:
User Summary

In this game you play as Kanye West. On twitter. You will compose tweets (pressing keyboard) and then post them. The faster you compose and post the tweets the more Kanye points you earn. With Kanye points you can follow other entities on twitter such as: fake Kanye, Waldo, Spam Bot, Barrack Obama, Fake Bear Facts, Taylor Swift and more. You don't actually choose what posts to make. Whatever keystrokes you enter in are interpreted by the game as the next in a preset text.

167999.name: Song of Drums and Tomahawks
167999.description:
Do you dare enter into the dark woodlands of early America?

The boom of a flintlock musket, a cloud of acrid black powder, and the drumming of feet as they rush towards the fallen foe. A knife is unsheathed, and with a few quick movements, the enemy’s bloody scalp is ripped free. Warfare in the Eastern Woodlands of America was one of raids, ambushes and sudden violent encounters. These are the skirmishes that Song of Drums and Tomahawks seeks to recreate. The French & Indian War is the most well-known conflict of this period, but these rules cover from the time of the European arrival until the mid-1800s. Players will generally control less than a dozen figures in multiplayer games, perhaps more in one-on-one contests. The fast-paced play, the tense decision making using simple, easy-to-learn rules, will lead to many fun and gripping games.

168000.name: Olav & The Lute
168000.description:
Olav & the Lute is a mystical adventure game. Dive into the post-apocalyptic fantasy world, solve puzzles, discover melodies, change the game-world with your mystical lute and .. fix it? Inspired by the old LOOM, Olav & the Lute makes use of an extraordinary gameplay mechanic. Discover the melodies of this magical world and use them to change other objects. It's not like something bad could happen, is it? Will you be able to figure out your mission, and let alone fulfill it? Play Olav & the Lute now for free!

Source: The Game Website.

167501.name: The Warlord's Vault
167501.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Swords & Wizardry Mini-Dungeon
For 4-6 Adventurers of Levels 6-8

Uther Grimwulf’s treasures lie entombed with him in a vault with seven locks. His final resting place was designed as a challenge to find a soul worthy enough to take up his arms and continue his fight. Are you worthy?

The Warlord’s Vault is sixth in a series of mini-dungeons designed to drop into existing adventures or campaigns. Use them as side quests or a way of getting in a quick adventure when you’re short on time.

167502.name: Statue of Liberty Adventure
167502.description:
From the back cover:

Your class is visiting the Statue of Liberty, and your first stop is the museum in the pedestal. One picture there shows a boatload of immigrants in 1907- and one of the kids in the photo looks exactly like you! Suddenly the floor lurches strangely, and when you catch your breath, you find yourself standing on the deck of a huge ship in the middle of the ocean. It's 1907 and you're a passenger on your way to the United States!

167503.name: Danger at Anchor Mine
167503.description:
From the back cover:

You're spending the summer in a little mining town. Anchor Mine has been closed for years, but one day you find an old diary that says there could be a fortune in undiscovered gold there! Everyone warns you to keep away from the mine- but you can't pass up the chance to strike it rich!

167504.description:
This expansion for Evolution includes:


7 "Unstable DNA" trait cards
6 Alternate format/art Species cards
Alternate first player marker
Set of five coasters (not part of game)
167504.name: Evolution: Promo Pack I

167505.name: Star Wars Force Grab
167505.description: With this fast-action family game, kids and adults will have to “use the force” to be victorious. To play, drop all 15 authentic Star Wars-themed pieces on the table. Then, draw a card—each has a grid with four different images of pieces turned any which way. The goal is to be the first person to announce which of the dropped pieces in their exact positions match the images on the card. The game will twist players’ minds and reaction times like never before!

167506.description:
Ragnaroll is a game of glory, death and dice. A great winter has descended upon the land, the sun has disappeared, the sea has frozen over, there's no more crops or cattle and all you have left is a few winter stores and, of course, your fluid Viking sense of ownership.

In Ragnaroll, you control a band of Viking warriors, each represented by a custom die, struggling to survive. Your band consists of a unique hero, 2 soldiers, 1 shieldmaiden and a loyal, but slightly unreliable, dog. You'll need to fight to protect your precious food stores, as well as raid your opponents for glory and more food. It's a harsh winter wasteland, and the last Viking alive wins, unless of course Ragnaroll happens first.

A round of Ragnaroll starts by revealing an event card, which will provide some incentives and rewards for your Vikings to leave their comfy halls. Next, players secretly separate their warriors into their defenders and their raiders. Players reveal their selection simultaneously and the boldest and bravest player, the one with the smallest raiding party, seizes the Initiative, gaining control of raid order for the round. If there's any ties, you'll need to literally seize the initiative by grabbing the initiative token from the centre of the table.

In the order of the Initiative holders choice, each player conducts a little bit of Norse business, pitting your raiders against your opponents defenders and using your defenders to protect your stores from your enemy’s raiders. Battle is resolved through rolling dice and using special battle abilities fuelled by glory. Each hero has a unique set of powers that will enable them to turn luck into fate. Each player, starting with the raider, will use a battle ability, and then the winner will be determined. Whoever has the most axes win, but you'll be able to block axes with shields and appeal to Odin to reroll results. The winner of the battle will get to steal stores or slay his opponent's warriors, but each player will also gain glory. In addition to glory provided through the event for the round, every hero has a different path to glory, some will delight in crushing their enemies, while others will be satisfied with survival and some may even gain glory through defeat.

After all players have raided, they will return to their falls and feed their warriors, but with stores running low, not all mouths are worth feeding. You can send any of your Vikings out into the snow for a long walk, saving precious resources, and if you get really desperate, you can even eat the dog. After you’ve fed, you’ll draw a new event card and start all over again. The game will end in one of 3 ways, each of which show the gods that one band of warriors is fit to fight alongside them in Ragnaroll. When there’s only one player with Vikings left, that player wins, demonstrating they have the strength and cunning to fight with the gods, but if all players run out of stores at the same time, you will all conduct one last glorious battle and the player with the most axes will emerge victorious. However, if any player is able to demonstrate they are truly worthy of the god’s favour by gaining 15 glory, they will immediately win and take their rightful place in Valhalla.

Ragnarol is a game where your choices matter. You’ll need to balance risk and rewards, and manage your precious, dwindling resources, making hard decisions for the survival of your clan. The dice-based combat doesn’t simply mean that your fate into the hands of the gods, as you’ll be able to influence the outcome of the battle using your glory-fueled powers, but you’ll need to choose the battles that are worth the cost.
167506.name: Ragnaroll

167507.name: Double Dragon Trilogy
167507.description:
User Summary

A groundbreaking, uber-popular game upon its arcade debut in 1987, Double Dragon is the undisputed godfather of co-op beat ‘em all!

Enter Double Dragon Trilogy, a compilation specially optimized for mobiles and which includes all three installments of the beloved arcade series: Double Dragon, Double Dragon 2: The Revenge, and Double Dragon 3: The Rosetta Stone. The first one begins with Billy and his brother Jimmy, two martial arts experts, in a mission to rescue Billy's girlfriend, Marian, who’s been kidnapped by the Black Shadows Gang. All your favorite moves are here: punches, kicks, elbows, knees, head-butts and an assortment of not-exactly-street-legal weapons.

167508.name: Frogger: Hyper Arcade Edition
167508.description:
User Summary

Frogger: Hyper Arcade Edition is an action game developed by Zombie Studios and published by Konami Digital Entertainment for the iPhone, iPad, Wii Shop, PlayStation 3 (PSN), and Xbox 360 (XBLA) platforms.

In addition to classic Frogger, Frogger: Hyper Arcade Edition includes six additional game modes, twenty challenges, and the ability to change the style from the 8-bit style of the original arcade game to a next-gen style or to mimic the style of several other Konami games.

167509.name: Girl Fight
167509.description:
User Summary
Girl Fight is a fighting game where the entire cast is female. Each of Girl Fight's characters can tap into customizable "psi-amp abilities" which give them access to various powers such as becoming invisible, regenerating health with each successful hit landed, or dealing bonus damage.

There is an in-game currency called "Combits" which accrues every time a player executes a move properly. Combits can be used at the in-game store to purchase extra abilities, unlock cast members' stories, alternative costumes, or bonus artwork.

The online "Wager System" will give players random challenges before a match; players who fulfill these challenges will be rewarded with Combits, even if they lose the overall match.

A scientific organization collects female subjects across the world with powerful psionic abilities. The women are plugged into a virtual world where they must fight to survive and return to the real world.

167510.name: Matka Keskiaikaan - Opas live-roolipelaajalle
167510.description:
User description:
Matka Keskiaikaan is Levande rollspel - Handbok (by Hans Käll) translated into finnish and edited to be more applicable to Finland's LARP scene. There has been added chapters about how to make your own boffer weapons, bow and arrows and chainmail. There is also added a translated version of Knight's Oath. These chapters have already been published in Larppaajan käsikirja.

Translated from back of the book:
Expert guide book for LARPer.
What is live action roleplaying?
How to organize a live action roleplaying event?
What kind of characters are there in LARP?
What equipment is need for a game?

This informative handbook is a guide to the world of live action roleplaying. It familiarizes reader thoroughly and down-to-earth into basics of LARPing and vocabulary and especially into games in the medieval spirit.

The book guides both beginner and more advanced player about preparing for a LARP. It gives information and excellent tips about development of a character as well as about typical medieval clothing, weaponry and cooking. The book with perceptual schematic drawings is regionalized to Finland.

The back of the book in finnish:
Asiantunteva opaskirja larppaajalle.
Mitä live-roolipelaaminen on?
Kuinka live-roolipeli järjestetään?
Millaisia ovat larpin roolihahmot?
Mitä varusteita peliin tarvitaan?

Tämä selkeä käsikirja johdattaa live-roolipelien maailmaan. Se tutustuttaa seikkaperäisesti ja käytännönläheisesti larppaamisen perusteisiin ja sanastoon sekä erityisesti keskiajan hengen mukaisiin peleihin.

Teos opastaa sekä vasta-alkajaa että edistyneempää pelaajaa live-roolipeliin valmistautumisessa. Se antaa tietoa ja oivia vinkkejä niin roolihahmon kehittämisessä kuin keskiajalle tyypillisestä vaatetuksesta, aseistuksesta ja ruoanvalmistuksesta. Havainnollisin piirroksin varustettu kirja on mukautettu Suomen oloihin.

167512.description:
The first in a series of sequel decks to the original, UK Games Expo Award Winning Lords of War games, this expansion adds a huge number of new Unit Types, new Ranks and new rules to the base game.

Alongside adding in new gameplay functions and mechanics, this expansion also introduces Moving Units to the Orc and Dwarf Factions.

The first of the major new Unit Types included in this expansion are Magic Units, capable of buffing allies and damaging foes using Elemental Attacks and Spell Tokens.

The game introduces Monstrous Units - extremely tough cards with 'Monstrous Defence' which allows them to ignore low damage attacks.

Finally, the Magic and Monsters Expansion also introduce Flying Units which are only vulnerable to Ranged Units and other Flying Units.

While primarily designed as an addition to Lords of War: Orcs versus Dwarves, this expansion is also compatible with all other Lords of War Factions and adds additional Command Cards, Special Units and Elite Units to the base game.
167512.name: Lords of War: Orcs versus Dwarves 2 – The Magic and Monsters Expansion

144988.name: Lords of War:  Elves versus Lizardmen

167513.description:
In Barony, players are ambitious barons trying to extend their dominion over the land! Who will succeed and become the new king?

At the beginning of the game, players create the board at random with nine tiles per player; each tile is comprised of three hexagons, with each hexagon being one of five landscape types: forest, plains, field, mountain, lake. Players then each place three cities on the game board, with a knight in each city. They then take turns in clockwise order, with each player taking exactly one action from the six possible actions:


Recruitment: Add two knights to a city, or three knights if the city is adjacent to a lake.
Movement: Move one or two of your knights one space each. A knight can't enter a lake (blub), a mountain with an opposing pawn, or any space with an opponent's city or stronghold or two knights of the same opposing color. If you move a second knight into a space with an opposing pawn or village, remove those tokens and take one resource from the village owner.
Construction: Remove one or more of your knights from the game board and replace each with a village or stronghold, gaining one resource token matching the landscape under the structure.
New City: Replace one of your villages with a city and earn 10 victory points (VPs).
Expedition: Remove two knights from your reserve, placing one back in the box out of play and the other on any empty space on the edge of the game board.
Noble Title: Discard at least 15 resource points, then upgrade your title: baron to viscount, then count, marquis and finally duke.


Once any player has gained the title of duke, finish the round, then tally the VPs, with players scoring for resources still in their possession, their rank in the game, and the number of cities they built. Whoever has the most VPs wins.
167513.name: Barony

167514.name: Super Duo
167514.description:
You'll never win alone.

In Super Duo, a group of wannabe superheroes have come together to deal with the city's most pressing problems. Only two of you can be true heroes. Meet your collective doom, or rise to Fame and Glory.

Super Duo is a short and simple card game. Collect, complete and collaborate in an epic quest. Strategic choices, a little luck, and a watchful eye on your friends are the key to winning.

167515.description:
An expansion released off the back of the Lords of War: Templars versus Undead Kickstarter Campaign, this expansion adds no new Units to Lords of War but instead adds two modifier decks to the base game.

The Terrain Deck enables players to build custom battlefields using cards which have a number of effects on the Units placed on top of them. This includes building 'Walls' and 'Gates' which may be destroyed or landscape features such as 'Hills' which increase damage dealt by Ranged Units or 'Marshes' into which Cavalry cannot be placed.

The Weather Deck meanwhile creates dynamic weather conditions, including 'Night' during which players can play two cards instead of one in their turn or 'Mist' which allows Infantry Units to deal more damage.

These decks can be used together or separately, and the expansion also includes a 'Retrieve The Dragon Egg' minigame which operates much like a 'Capture The Flag' mode.
167515.name: Lords of War: Weather and Terrain Expansion Pack

144988.name: Lords of War:  Elves versus Lizardmen

167517.name: Bruce Moose on the Loose
167517.description: Bruce Moose is set in motion and he moves around while playing music. The first kid to get rings off in the antlers. Get all those in your color off and you win...

167521.name: Shadow Blade
167521.description:
From the developer:

Shadow Blade is a fast-paced ninja platforming game for iPad/iPhone and Android devices (including Ouya), from Dead Mage Game Studio. It features intuitive touch controls and an array of weapons and challenging levels. Shadow Blade: Reload is the enhanced version of the game for PC that includes a full level editor to create and share levels. Becoming a ninja is at your fingertips!

Kuro is a young man on his quest to become the Shadow Blade. He must seek the teachings of the last remaining ninja master. You will guide him through challenging levels, around countless traps, sneaking past enemies or right over their dead bodies. You have to be fast, be stealthy, be aware of your environment. You have to be a ninja.

Source: The Developer Website.


From Wikipedia:

The game consists of bite sized levels and rewards the player based on three factors: the total time to traverse the level from start to the end, the number of orbs collected across the level and the number of hidden objects found.

The main challenges revolve around precision platforming, combat and stealth play.

Source: Wikipedia, "Shadow Blade", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167523.name: Garshasp: Temple of the Dragon
167523.description:
The mighty mythological hero, Garshasp, travels into distant lands in search for the secrets hidden in the temple of the dragon, unaware of the hidden dangers and creatures awaiting him in the cursed lands.

Garshasp is based on ancient Persian mythology bringing to life the epic battles of the mythological hero, Garshasp, in the ancient lands against the evil monsters. You play as Garshasp himself, the strongest man in Persian Mythology.

Source: The Developer Website.

167524.name: Clash of Puppets
167524.description:
Help Charlie getting out of his own nightmares!
Clash of Puppets is a full 3D hack’n’slash platformer, featuring classic b-movie style.
Adventure through 3 worlds of frantic levels. Use tons of devastating weapons and traps against hordes of puppets!

Features:
– High quality 3d Graphics: Fully animated 3D characters with dynamic lighting.
– Vast Arsenal: Find and use tons of devastating weapons and traps.
– Long Lasting: Inspired by B-movies of the 20th century, Clash of Puppets will feature 3 worlds to experience and an infinite survival mode.
– Challenge: your friends try to achieve the best score to be the “Survival Hero”.
– Console-Style: Experience a true console style hack’n’slash platformer game on your mobile device.
– Game Center: Leaderboards and lots of achievements.

Source: The Developer Website.

167525.name: Optical Inquisitor
167525.description:
It's the year 1988. Acid wash jeans are in. Our hero, Tommy Rissken has been betrayed by his friends and had to serve a prison sentence for 8 years. Now he’s back with a vengeance. With your help, he’ll get his revenge on his 'friends' and be able to return to his daughter.

Compatible with iPhone 4, iPad 2 and up.

Features:
– Superior Sniper mechanics
– Great ragdoll physics, destructible bodies
– Racing and Underground Gamblers Club
– Great cartoon animations
– Amazing 80s style soundtrack from 'Perturbator', 'RTRY', 'Vector Hold', 'Protector-101', 'Palm Highway Chase', 'Tommy', 'Betamaxx', 'Flash Аrnold', 'M-Town Vice', 'Vincenzo Salvia’, 'Hot Hot Hawk', 'Brutal Pony Riders', 'Bestrack', 'The Аstral Stereo Project', 'Bourgeoisie', 'Mr Pteez', 'Quasars, 'DrPECCO'
– Build your own weapons
– Great interactive elements in levels
– Old 80's style cell phones
– No IAP

Source: The Developer Website.

167526.name: Strike Wing: Raptor Rising

videogameexpansion.167527: Strike Wing: Raptor Rising - Expansion 1: The Rising Hand

167526.description:
Take over the stars, blast through enemy fighter waves and destroy capital ships while piloting the most advanced fighters in the galaxy. As a member of the elite black ops DSO-01 squadron you will investigate the Sirius Incident, the largest friendly fire engagement in history.

Done with story missions? The challenge missions will keep you entertain and adjust to your skill and play-style.

Strike Wing is a single player space combat simulator for iOS, Android and Windows Phone that combines sharp controls, beautiful graphics, adaptable missions and a new game expansion system to create an unique space combat experience for mobile devices.

Source: The Game Website.

167527.name: Strike Wing: Raptor Rising - Expansion 1: The Rising Hand
167527.description:
The first free expansion (available for download in-game) adds 3 new missions and 5 powerful new ships to your arsenal. Obliterate your enemies using the heavy Albatross gunship or engage into close dogfights while piloting the Hyena light fighter.

Complete the following heart-pounding missions:
• Rogue Squadron - Rising Hand elements have been detected near an abandoned orbital station. Terminate with extreme prejudice.
• Operation Twin Lance - Two enemy corvettes, the Phalanx and Harpoon have been located in the Kappa Phoenicis asteroid field. Infiltrate the convoy and destroy it before the corvettes can escape.
• Operation Lifeblood - Protect the TN Bowman, a supply vessel that's bringing critical resources to the Raptor. Rising Hand forces have set-up an ambush in a nearby asteroid field.

Source: The Game Website.

167528.name: Strike Wing: Raptor Rising - Expansion 2: The High Guard
167528.description:
Fly 3 new advanced spacecraft belonging to the High Guard. The fast Blackwing, the powerful Rhino and the intimidating Raven are the perfect weapons to dominate any battlefield. These spacecraft have very good shields and energy reserves, however they lack in the hull resistance department.

New mission:
• Guardian Raptor - The High Guard has attacked the Raptor convoy and is blocking their jump drives with an interdictor. Make sure all ships survive the encounter.

Source: The Game Website.

167529.name: Strike Wing: Raptor Rising - Expansion 3: Story Mode Chapter 1
167529.description:
Discover the story of the Deep Space Operation 01 Squadron as they solve the first chapter of the Sirius Incident mystery.

Source: The Game Website.

167530.name: You Don't Know Jack XXL

videogamecompilation.152556: You Don't Know Jack Vol. 1 XL

167530.description:
User Summary

The irreverent quiz show is back. This collection contains YDKJ XL and the normal release of YDKJ Vol. 2

167531.name: You Don't Know Jack Huge XXXL
167531.description:
User Summary

The trivia quiz series continues with this collection of 2400 questions, featuring 800 each from You Don't Know Jack, You Don't Know Jack Volume 2, and You Don't Know Jack Volume 3. For players familiar with the earlier titles, gameplay remains essentially the same with a mix of original music, irreverent questions, unusual formats, a vast array of sound effects and the in-your-face sarcastic host(s).

167532.name: Die Jagd nach dem Glück
167532.description: The goal of the game is to be the first player to reach the star in the center of the game board. The players each have one meeple of a different size. The bigger ones are superior to the ones of the next smaller size. The smallest meeple is superior to the biggest one. If two meeples of two consecutive sizes are on the same grey or black ring, with no other meeple between them, the superior one can exchange places with the minor one, if the minor one ist the preceeding one on the track. If the superior mepple is the preceeding one, the minor meeple has to go back 3 spaces.

167533.name: You Don't Know Jack: The Irreverent Collection
167533.description:
User Summary

You Don't Know Jack --The Irreverent Collection is a collection of the original four You Don't Know Jack games, Volumes 1, 2, 3 and 4, plus a bonus CD with only audio from the first three volumes.

167534.name: You Don't Know Jack Pack
167534.description:
User Summary

The You Don't Know Jack! Pack contains three great games from the acclaimed trivia series -- included are You Don't Know Jack! Sports, You Don't Know Jack! TV and You Don't Know Jack! Movies.

167535.name: You Don't Know Jack Jumbo
167535.description:
User Summary

You Don't Know Jack Jumbo is a five-game compilation of the first four You Don't Know Jack games and You Don't Know Jack Offline. Each game comes on a separate disc (two for You Don't Know Jack: The Ride) and with its own game manual.

Each title is a presented in a game show format, with up to three players going head to head in a trivia quiz challenge. Of course, these are not your normal garden-variety quiz questions. Questions can be lewd, suggestive, and in the case of You Don't Know Jack 4: The Ride, even downright raunchy.

167536.name: You Don't Know Jack Snack Pack
167536.description:
User Summary

You Don't Know Jack: Snack Pack yields four complete servings of previously released YDKJ titles in one ready-to-serve package. Included are the original You Don't Know Jack, You Don't Know Jack Movies, You Don't Know Jack TV, and You Don't Know Jack Vol. 4: The Ride.

167537.name: Neon Shadow
167537.description:
Neon Shadow is a first person shooter that aims to revive the “run and gun” gameplay of shooters from the 90′s. You play as an agent sent to deal with malfunctioning cybernetics on a space station. These become your enemies, and you must take them down as they become increasingly hostile. The game is inspired by sci-fi classics and has a definite cyberpunk twist with a soundtrack from the cyberpunk outfit “Abducted by Sharks”.

Source: The Developer Website.


Neon Shadow is a fast paced Cyber Punk FPS inspired by classic shooters. Suit up and grab your shotgun. Your mission is to save humanity from the dark mechanoids who have taken control of your space station and soon the rest of the galaxy!

Features:
• Multiplayer.
• Old school first person shooter game-play.
• Single player campaign.
• Online multiplayer death-match mode.
• LAN multiplayer death-match.
• Cyber Punk soundtrack from Abducted by Sharks.
• Google Play Game Services.
• Controller support for Moga Pro Mode B
• Controller support for Game Stop Red Samurai

When playing with a controller: (Android + controller setup)
- Support for multiple control layouts: South paw and legacy

On tablets:
- 2 player split screen on one device: co-op campaign and death-match modes.

Source: The Developer Website.

167538.name: You Don't Know Jack: 5th Dementia Party Pack
167538.description:
User Summary

A special edition of YDKJ: 5th Dementia that contains 2 copies of YDNJ 5th Dementia. One for you and one for your friends.

167539.name: Fading Fairytales
167539.description:
These fairytales are really fractured! Have you been waiting for an App Store game that ticks all the boxes: retro, funny, slick and beautiful? Fading Fairytales is an action RPG that sees a cast of memorable animal characters team up against some of the most familiar fairytale characters available: Robin Hood, Aladdin, Pinocchio and more! Prepare to experience a deep story that takes you through the whole Fairytale World as you command Amon the Anteater and his wacky allies on their epic journey of friendship and danger!

Source: The Developer Website.

167540.name: You Don't Know Jack: Free V!
167540.description:
User Summary

This Collection Gives You YDK: TV plus 2 of the following choices: Vol. 1 XL, Vol. 2, Vol. 3, The Ride, Vol. 6, Sports, Movies, HeadRush

167541.name: You Don't Know Jack Offline Collection

videogamecompilation.80901: You Don't Know Jack Louder! Faster! Funnier!

167541.description:
User Summary

A collection of both online based versions of YDKJ.

167542.name: The 5th Land
167542.description:
THEME
...it's the year 2099.

The polar ice caps melted 10 years ago, resulting in a rapid increase in the world's sea level.
Cities drowned, the world's plains turned into lakes, mountains became islands.
Whole populations were wiped out.
The food shortage brought the wars...

Now we are all divided into 4 main alliances, where each one fights for the last remaining pieces of land.
Each one struggles to reach the pivotal point and control... The 5th Land

THE BOARD
The board can be setup to show 11.664 different map formations,
assuring a different world every time you play and always the need for a new strategy.

GAMEPLAY
In The5thLand, each player represents one of the 4 main alliances whose aim is to occupy 5 lands, by controling the worlds resources, bankrupting their enemies and ultimately by war.

In the beginning each player starts with 2 Lands, 2 Army units and a Supply Center with 5 of each resources and 75 Million Credits.

Each Round consists of 4 main Phases where the players have the opportunity to:

Extract the resources from the territories they occupy.
Build additional Military units (Land/Air/Navy).
Trade on the world markets, Resources and Military units.
Move military units around the globe to achieve a strategic advantage and Attack when the time is right...




The players may act or not in each Phase (clockwise direction) and when all have played, they move on the next Phase.

VICTORY
When at least one player occupies five Lands, the game finishes at the end of that Round.
If two or more players have at least five lands, then the player with the most lands wins.
If there is still a tie, then the player with the most money, minus any loans, wins the game.

THE NATIONS
The world has come together to form 4 main alliances, each one having a unique advantage in the game:

Demeter Federation: an Eco-friendly society, whose efforts have resulted in an abundance of food resources.
Dionysus Coalition: the scavengers of the world, rumor has it that they can smell Oil from a mile away.
Hephaestus League: the steampunk nation, with a special affinity for Gold.
Poseidon Empire: the sea power of the game, their motto: 'In a world of water, Ships are gods'.

167543.name: You Don't Know Jack: Not Ready For The Future
167543.description:
User Summary

A collection of YDKJ Vol 1 XL, Vol 2, and Sports.

167544.name: You Don't Know Jack: Best Of Cookie
167544.description:
User Summary

A collection of 3 YDKJ games. YDKJ Vol 3, Vol 4, and Movies.

167545.name: You Don't Know Jack Mega Pack

videogamecompilation.152556: You Don't Know Jack Vol. 1 XL

167545.description:
User Summary

A collection of the main 5 YDKJ games. Contains Vol.1 XL + Vol.2 + Vol.3 + The Ride + The Lost Gold

167546.name: You Don't Know Jack: Classic Pack
167546.description:
User Summary

A collection of 9 games in the YDKJ series. Included is YDKJ Vol.1 XL, Vol.2, Vol.3, The Ride, The Lost Gold, Sports, Movies, TV, and HeadRush.

167547.name: Anduin (Issue 92 - Jun 2005) Zwischen den Sternen
167547.description:
This science-Fiction themed issue contains scenarios for several SF systems, including Entaria (not yet in the database), short stories for Lodland, articles (e.g. on genetics), an interview with Raymond E. Feist, comic, and reviews.

Similar to the situation in summer 2003, Tommy Heinig declares that he won't continue Anduin. For two and a half years, Anduin ceased publication.

167548.name: Spur ins Dunkel
167548.description:
Spur ins Dunkel
Ein Mann blickt in den Spiegel und sieht …?
Jeder Mensch möchte wissen, woher er stammt. Auch der Arzt Samuel Beaver. Als Säugling ausgesetzt, blieb ihm als Hinweis nur ein Amulett. Nach langen Jahren der Suche hat er endlich eine konkrete Spur. Wohin sie ihn führt, verrät er niemandem; er will alle überraschen.
Tage später schickt die verzweifelte Ehefrau die Detektive auf die Suche. Wie Teile eines Puzzles müssen sie die Spuren eines Mannes zusammensammeln, der scheinbar spurlos verschwunden ist. Ihre Forschungen führen sie quasi auf Europatournee: von London in ein englisches Dörfchen, nach Dover und Calais und schließlich nach Wien.
Zurück in London blicken sie in Samuel Beavers Spiegel. Und müssen erkennen, dass ihre Suche sie wie den Arzt zuvor ins Dunkel führte.

Abrakadabra
Und plötzlich ist er weg! Wie durch Zauberei! Gerade eben noch lag der wertvolle Ring auf seinem Samtkissen, dann landete er zusammen mit dem Kaffeeservice auf dem Boden. Das Juwelierspaar Weilersdorf ist verzweifelt. Ob die ungarische Gräfin und ihr Diener damit zu tun haben? Aber wie haben sie es gemacht?
Die Detektive erwartet eine spannende Verfolgungsjagd durch Wien mit einem trickreichen Ende.

Wien - Kleine Rundschau
Die Metropole an der viel besungenen blauen Donau ist eine Reise wert. Mit Oper und Prater, Museen, Heurigen und zahlreichen Sehenswürdigkeiten stellt sie die Detektive schon fast vor die Qual der Wahl. Im Fiaker sitzend Hofburg und Stephansdom an sich vorüberziehen zu lassen und anschließend im Kaffeehaus einen Katerkaffee oder Pharisäer schlürfen, ist sicher eine willkommene Abwechslung zur alltäglichen Verbrecherjagd.

Google translation
Track in the dark
A man looks in the mirror and sees ...?
Everyone wants to know where he comes from. The physician Samuel Beaver. Exposed as an infant, he remained as an indication only an amulet. After many years of searching, he finally has a concrete track. Where it leads him, he tells anyone; he wants to surprise everyone.
Days later, the desperate wife sends the detectives to search. As pieces of a puzzle together, they must collect the traces of a man who is seemingly vanished without a trace. Her research they perform quasi touring Europe: London in an English village, to Dover and Calais, and finally to Vienna.
Back in London, they look to Samuel Beavers mirror. And must recognize that their search led as the doctor into the darkness before.

Abracadabra
And suddenly it's gone! As if by magic! Just barely the valuable ring was on his velvet cushion, then he ended up with the coffee service on the ground. The jeweler pair hamlet village is desperate. Whether the Hungarian countess and her servants to do with it? But how do they do it?
The detectives can expect an exciting chase through Vienna with a tricky end.

Vienna - Little Review
The metropolis on the much celebrated Blue Danube is worth a visit. With Opera and Prater, museums, wine tavern, and numerous tourist attractions, the detectives she almost spoiled for choice. To be sitting Hofburg and St. Stephen's pass in the cab itself and then sip coffee or a hangover Pharisees in the cafe, is certainly a welcome change from the everyday manhunt.

167549.description:
Ideal for small tournament or casual play support.

(8) Battle Screecher cards (2) Megahauler cards

Star Realms is a space combat deckbuilding game designed by Magic Pro Tour Champions and Hall of Famers Darwin Kastle and Rob Dougherty (developer and cofounder of the Ascension Deckbuilding Game).
Enjoy the thrill of TCG-Style combat in a deckbuilding game. Play powerful ships, destroy enemy bases, and blast your opponent directly on the way to victory!
167549.name: Star Realms: Game Day Pack (May – July)

167550.name: Playing Your Cards Right
167550.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventure in the lands of the northern lights.

This adventure for use with the Heroes Wear Masks RPG system comes with everything you need to run the adventure as well as figure flats of all the characters you will encounter in the game.

167551.name: 101 Not So Simple Monster Templates (13th Age)

rpgissuearticle.132616: 101 Not So Simple Monster Templates (13th Age)

167551.description:
From publisher blurb:

Think you've seen it all?

It's a big, scary world out there, and for your players, it's gotten nastier. 101 Not So Simple Monster Templates gives you more options, more creative flexibility and more ways to just freak out your players with new templates - itching to be added to any 13th Age Roleplaying Game monster.

Enjoy simple templates like cowardly creature who just wants to run away (even if he is a tarrasque). The Walking Fortress which makes the monster really big and puts a citadel on its back, and the Riven Magic Creature, who just wants to drain you of your spells and break your magic items.

This collection brings you an even vaster array of new options to surprise even the most jaded of players with strange and exciting encounters. 101 Not So Simple Monster Templates will give your party something to remember for a long time - if they survive!

167552.name: Build Up
167552.description: Compete in this tower building game with twenty blocks of various sizes and shapes. The object is to place a block in such a way that it causes the next player to topple the tower. Players use cards to determine which blocks are available.

167553.name: Ghosts in the Machine
167553.description:
From publisher blurb:

Thousands of years ago, an insidious alien war machine called a “suppression pod” spun off-course and crashed into a moon’s ice-locked surface. Knocked offline by the impact and flash-frozen in seconds, the pod lay dormant for millennia. Reactivated by recent mining activity, the deviceresumed its original programming! JumpCorp sends a rapid-response team to nullify the threat by any means necessary.

167555.name: WarMage: Apprentice Edition
167555.description:
"The fragile peace between mages has always been kept by the legendary WarMage of High Bastion. From the Stone Seat, the authority of the WarMage over the mages of Elerania has been absolute and unchallenged for decades... until now.
Now the WarMage is dead, the world of mages is in chaos, and the Stone Seat stands empty--waiting for the most ambitious, most powerful mage to claim its glory..."

WarMage: Apprentice Edition is the first installment in the WarMage series, a stand-alone competitive card game in the style of Yu-Gi-Oh! or Magic: The Gathering, for two to nine players of all ages and suitable for challenging both beginners and veterans alike.
Summon your magical might and do battle against other aspiring mages, wielding communal spells from six unique disciplines of magic to launch attacks, hinder your opponents, empower yourself, and control the battlefield in a shifting, dynamic fight to be the last mage standing!

In this game, a myriad of spells from several themed disciplines of magic are drawn from a central, shared deck, and are played in a variety of ways from players' hands in an effort to defeat their opponents. In the basic game mode, the last player standing wins; several variant game modes can also be played, to change the rules of the game itself.

167556.name: ALARRYiens's Notes of the Underground (Number 1 - May 2013)
167556.description:
Publisher's Blurb

This electronic newsletter is going to bring you my thoughts on
what's going down out in the world of Cyberspace, the Net, or whatever you want to call it. My name is ALARRYien. That's pronounced AIL-LARRY-EN, get it. I'll be putting this out when I feel like it. You can find it at the usual places. I'll be archiving them too.

167557.name: Friar's Almanac (Issue 1 - Sep 2009)
167557.description:
Publisher's Description

Welcome to the first issue of Friar's Almanac where we will take a hard look at the current roleplaying game market. We will include articles about both official Dungeons and Dragons products and 3rd party offerings. We will feature news, articles, and how-to's about everything from generic roleplaying games to electronic products.
We allow user submissions and we are advertiser supported. Check out our table of contents for this month:

A Yellow Dingo Ate My Baby
Event of the Moon
Goblin Poetry Invitational
About a Dungeon
Real Medieval Stuff
Doomesday Book
Wallesgrave Manor
Swinfield Vinyard
Ombersley Tennant Farm

Roleplaying
Rollplaying
Electronic Dungeons and Dragons
Preview: inCombat4E
Review: D&D Insider Character Builder
Review: D&D Insider Adventure Tools
Fiend of the Age
In Lands Where Chaos Reigns
Other Worlds than These
A Random Dwelling
A Random Dungeon
A Random Battlemat
Contributions
Quote of the Month

167558.name: Friar's Almanac (Issue 2 - Oct 2009)
167558.description:
Publisher's description

The second issue of the Friar's Almanac. This month we take a look at other games systems, an interview with James M. Ward, living equipment, goblin poetry, sci-fi roleplaying games, phychology and roleplaying, another Skill Conduit Contest, and much much more!

Contents this month:

Giant Carnivorous Slug Correspondence ....... 4
Oops We Messed Up! .......................... 6
A Yellow Dingo Ate My Baby .................. 8
The Real World .............................. 11
The Brynryfe Campaign ....................... 17

Rowan's Weekend ............................. 91
Skill Conduit Contest ....................... 101
Other Worlds than These ..................... 104

167559.name: Friar's Almanac (Issue 3 - Nov 2009)
167559.description:
Publisher's Description

Its Steampunk month at the Friar's Almanac! Here is what we have this month:

GOING STEAMPUNK BAD
ALBREKTS GUIDE TO GATE TRAVEL
THE MARK OF A CIVILIZATION
