Stranger things still are found in sky and sea, from flying polyps and bholes to eyes of the deep, and impossible creatures from places beyond understanding like the dream-haunting nightgaunt and the mysterious color out of space. A dozen and one corrupt creatures of every description lie within, from CR 3 to 25, but if two whole books of mythic mythos monsters are just not enough we also provide you with the new xenoid template and its even more awful mythic xenoid version, to turn the humblest creature to a pseudonatural terror of unnatural menace.

167771.name: 13 Evil Spells
167771.description:
publisher blurb

Evil spells -- they're not easier, just a lot more fun.

Inside this wicked spell book you will find 13 new evil spells for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game perfect for adding a unique malevolence to your latest villainous character.

167772.name: The Sanguine Disciple: A Maneuvers Base Class
167772.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unlock the power of the heart's blood!

"Religious dogma insists that we accept that the gods are all-powerful, effectively omnipotent save for when they step on the toes of another god. If that were so, why does every god have at least a passing interest in the maintenance of an array of mortal worshippers? The fact is we do not factor into the motivations of the vast majority of the gods unless we 'mere mortals' are, in fact, the very source of their great powers. Why not keep these powers for yourself?"

Strange warriors who elect to worship the potential of mortal flesh rather than the gods, sanguine disciples use themselves as ritual foci, drawing from their own vitality to fuel both great feats of strength and powerful magic. Despite the common perception, not all sanguine disciples are walking pillars of muscle. Indeed, bodily constitution, not aesthetics, is the true measure of a sanguine disciple, and the barrel-chested tavern brawler the next town over may be closer to their definition of the mortal ideal than the handsome traveling performer.

The sanguine disciple is a new take on the concept of martial maneuvers, combining a pool system that replenishes itself on kill, "combo point" tracking for the use of devastating finishers in a long fight, stacking bleed effects, and heavy use of both swift action and standard action abilities to make skirmishing not only viable, but downright more powerful than full attacks if you play your cards right. Sanguine disciples can easily bleed out the most powerful of creatures in short order, but those who do not pace themselves may find their body overtaxed and be forced to drain themselves of their own bodily Constitution to keep maneuvering.

Product Features

Favored class options for all common races, as well as most featured races.
Innovative blood point system fuels complex maneuvers and also allows for temporary reduction of the characters own Constitution score to keep doing the flashy stuff
Nearly 80 bloodsongs (maneuvers) in four distinct types
builder – active ability that generates focus in addition to other effects
finisher – active ability that requires focus to perform
harmony – stances that grant a benefit, but impose a related penalty
resonance – passive bonuses

167773.name: Wanted
167773.description:
From publisher blurb:

Written for the most recent edition of the most popular fantasy role playing game!

This supplement is a collection of 10 very short adventures meant to be dropped into an existing low-level campaign. Each short adventure should provide enough material for a single session of play.

Additionally this supplement provides optional rules involving chase scenes, and hazards that may befall characters that venture into the sewers.

Happy hunting!

167774.name: Spot it! Fire & Ice
167774.description: Spot it! Fire & Ice pits players against an electric timer. Race to spot matches and beat the buzzer, while looking for your chance to freeze and burn your opponents. Features more than 50 different images of hot and cold objects.

167775.name: Dancing Storm
167775.description:
Daimyō Tsuyoi from the town of Hikari in the province of Heiwa has had his great sword, Dansu no Arashi (Dancing Storm) stolen. As one of Daimyō's servants, you feel responsible, as you were perhaps present nearby when it happened. You will travel Heiwa and beyond to retrieve the Daimyō's Katana and receive honour to you and your family

Source: The Publisher Website.

167776.name: The Spare Set
167776.description:
A Twine story game by Shelter, the housing and homelessness charity.

Explore the story of Lucy, a woman struggling to keep her family safe and happy in a world of rising costs, lowering wages, and disappearing support.

Source: The Game Website.

167777.name: The Lunastone
167777.description:
On a far distant ocean planet you live peacefully with your daughter on one of the many islands. Out of the blue your daughter goes missing. She had been kidnapped by your insane brother. You must find and steal the Lunastone, a powerful weapon, to be found on a secret island. If you don't steal it for him your daughter will die.

Source: The Publisher Website.

167778.name: Worlds Without Master (Volume 1, Epimas Annex - Dec 2013)
167778.description:
Editor's introduction:

Behold, our little holiday surprise! As the year draws to an end and we reflect on what has come before, I find myself looking ever further ahead. I see there, on the horizon, new destinations that I could not see a year ago. I am eager to travel them.

167779.name: SuperHot (web browser)
167779.description:
ABOUT SUPERHOT

SUPERHOT is a unique, stylish first-person shooter game where time moves only when you move.

With this simple mechanic we've been able to create gameplay that's not all about reflexes - the player's main weapon is careful aiming and smart planning - while not compromising on the dynamic feeling of the game.

Take your time. You have as much as you want.

It started out as a 7 Day First Person Shooter (7DFPS) game jam project made by a group of friends in August 2013. After releasing the prototype of SUPERHOT to the Internet, it quickly became very popular - the game was featured on sites like RPS, PCGamer, GiantBomb and more!.

Thanks to the support of our fans, SUPERHOT went through the Steam Greenlight process during a single weekend. This allowed us to expand the team and start remaking the prototype into a full-blown game.

On May 14th, 2014 we launched a Kickstarter campaign which was funded within the first 23 hours. In the end we received over $250,000 from our community - many thanks to all who backed SUPERHOT!

The game's target release date is June 2015.

Source: The Developer Website.

167780.name: Paper Toss
167780.description:
Paper Toss is a fast, fun, new card game where players compete to deliver the most newspapers on their paper route.

Paper Toss can be played by 2 to 6 players in anywhere from 10 to 30 minutes (more players make longer games), and the rules are simple and easy to learn, suitable for ages 5 and up.

The comical art and theme, coupled with the silly, competitive nature of the game make it great for younger children and even the whole family.

Draw cards from the blue "Paper Deck," and take turns trying to toss your newspaper on a new doormat (by playing the "Paper Toss" card), as other players try to throw off your aim with hazards like angry dogs, sidewalk obstacles, and neighborhood kids. If you have the appropriate counter card, you can ignore the distraction.

A simple discard mechanic adds a subtle layer of strategy: choose which cards to hold or discard, keeping your defensive cards, or going on the offense. Wild cards like "Flat Tire!" and "Bully!" help you stick it to your opponent and gain an upper hand.

Once you throw your paper, turn over a card from the green "Toss Deck," to see how good your throw was. With every successful paper toss, you gain a Paper Token. The first player to collect 10 Tokens wins the game! Can you be the first one to toss all your papers?

167781.name: SUPERHOT

videogamehonor.32088: 2014 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Nominee

167781.description:
Superhot sets the player in a minimalistic environment, taking out hostile attackers that are trying to kill them. Weapons picked up by the player have limited ammunition, requiring the player to rely on defeating enemies to get more ammo, or making melee kills. Taking a single hit from an enemy bullet kills the player, requiring them to restart the level. Though the game mechanics are typical of most shooters, the distinguishing feature is that time only moves forward at normal speed when the player performs an action like moving or firing a gun, otherwise time moves very slowly; this is described in the game's tagline "Time Moves Only When You Move".

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Superhot Superhot]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167782.name: Ratz Instagib
167782.description:
User Summary

A network multiplayer FPS browser game. Everyone has the same weapon, with unlimited ammo and range. Select the color of your beam, and the color of all your enemies. Try to get the most kills in your group to win the match.

167783.name: Ichabot Crane
167783.description:
Legends tell of the savior of our kind, the Horseless Headless Horsebot known by the name Ichabot Crane. Upon being separated from its mount by a powerful adversary, Ichabot was imprisoned within a dark dungeon. All hope seemed lost for Ichabot until one day, when a portal appeared within the cell. A voice from beyond came from the portal, offering Ichabot a chance at escaping its fate if Ichabot could, in turn, prove its worth to this mysterious benefactor. So begins the tale of Ichabot's escape from the evil space dungeon to freedom.

Ichobot Crane is an open-source, Global Game Jam 2014 (#ggj14) entry from American University at Washington, D.C., made by a team of 5. It's a first-person puzzle game like Portal that involves using your head...by throwing it.

Source: The Game Website.

167784.name: Crisis at Marstan
167784.description:
From publisher blurb:

After the last adventure you are now on a quest to find a warm bed and good food. Passing travelers have pointed out that you are quite close to the Thorp of Marstan, a small settlement in the area under the control of the Earl of Sakov. His troops are well known for their horsemanship skills and after all your walking perhaps you may find proper mounts! What the party will find is a community fearful from recent humanoid attacks but with the passing of a guard unit they have hope….except the guard unit hasn’t been heard from since.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a pair of low level players in the FD series. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

167785.name: Sagas
167785.description:
From the back of the box:

An easy and challenging game for the whole family. You are in charge of a group of warriors and must win the saga by using strategy and fantasy. The different groups, sagas and sceneries make the game a new adventure every time you play.

Each player selects a team of generic fantasy creatures, ranging from humans and ełves to undead and demons. Each team consists of 4 to 6 pieces.

When teams have been selected, one of the players rolls a ten-sided dice to determine which saga the players will play. These range from simple "Death matchs" to gathering chests.

Now the players form the board by placing lagre hexagon map pieces. Each map pieces contains smaller hexagons and terrain features like houses, trees and rocks.

Each saga (scenario) has a trigger. When a certain point in the game is reach, for example by losing half of your team, a set of "Time piece" markers is placed beside the game board. Each full turn a marker is turned and when a red time piece is revealed the game stops.

In the end points are calculated by simple measures such how many playing pieces you have left or how many treasure chests you've got.

167786.name: One-Minute War
167786.description:
You and your opponent each command a tiny army of five soldiers. Each round, you and your opponent simultaneously choose one of your soldiers to fight. However, not every soldier is created equal--some are stronger than others, and some have special abilities. Can you anticipate your opponent's move and choose a soldier that will beat his? Will he make the "obvious" choice, or will he pull a bluff...or a double-bluff? Win the war by defeating all of your opponent's soldiers, or having more remaining soldiers when the war is over.

This game requires one card (included in the download) and three hands--one of yours, one belonging to a friend, and another one of yours to hold the card. No tabletop needed.

167787.name: Die die DIE
167787.description:
In Die die, DIE! you and your adversaries trying to conquer territories flicking die and choose the better strategy to gain more points after the 4 Eras of the game.

On your turn you can choose one of the 5 platforms to flick one die and where's the die falls it's your territory (for now)...

After all the players using his dice there's a "struggle" when the dice are compared and who have more points (visible face of a die) claims that territory...

After 4 turns, the player with more points is the winner...

167788.name: Ending
167788.description:
User Summary

Ending is a puzzle game. You have a limited number of movement points to get your avatar, @ to the end. There are a number of obstacles you must negotiate. Many of these obstacles move with you and will attack. You can attack and destroy some of them by moving toward them if you are adjacent to them. If you move toward an obstacle that can attack, and it's attacking end is pointed toward you you will be destroyed and have to restart the level. Some obstacle units have multiple attacking ends. There are a number obstacle types and you will have to discover their behavior as you play.

167789.name: The Naked Painting
167789.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Naked Painting is a steampunk agent chasing scenario for four to five players set in a fictional Victorian age European setting around 1880.

167790.name: Thou Shall Obey
167790.description:
From publisher blurb:

Who’s really in charge in The White House? A scary story about conviction and high intrigue at underground Washington D.C.

A role playing scenario for approx. 5 players.

boardgamehonor.40553: 2016 Golden Geek Best Solo Board Game Nominee

167791.description:
In the 2400s, mankind begins to terraform the planet Mars. Giant corporations, sponsored by the World Government on Earth, initiate huge projects to raise the temperature, the oxygen level, and the ocean coverage until the environment is habitable. In Terraforming Mars, you play one of those corporations and work together in the terraforming process, but compete for getting victory points that are awarded not only for your contribution to the terraforming, but also for advancing human infrastructure throughout the solar system, and doing other commendable things.

The players acquire unique project cards (from over two hundred different ones) by buying them to their hand. The projects (cards) can represent anything from introducing plant life or animals, hurling asteroids at the surface, building cities, to mining the moons of Jupiter and establishing greenhouse gas industries to heat up the atmosphere. The cards can give you immediate bonuses, as well as increasing your production of different resources. Many cards also have requirements and they become playable when the temperature, oxygen, or ocean coverage increases enough. Buying cards is costly, so there is a balance between buying cards (3 megacredits per card) and actually playing them (which can cost anything between 0 to 41 megacredits, depending on the project). Standard Projects are always available to complement your cards.

Your basic income, as well as your basic score, is based on your Terraform Rating (starting at 20), which increases every time you raise one of the three global parameters. However, your income is complemented with your production, and you also get VPs from many other sources.

Each player keeps track of their production and resources on their player boards, and the game uses six types of resources: MegaCredits, Steel, Titanium, Plants, Energy, and Heat. On the game board, you compete for the best places for your city tiles, ocean tiles, and greenery tiles. You also compete for different Milestones and Awards worth many VPs. Each round is called a generation (guess why) and consists of the following phases:

1) Player order shifts clockwise.
2) Research phase: All players buy cards from four privately drawn.
3) Action phase: Players take turns doing 1-2 actions from these options: Playing a card, claiming a Milestone, funding an Award, using a Standard project, converting plant into greenery tiles (and raising oxygen), converting heat into a temperature raise, and using the action of a card in play. The turn continues around the table (sometimes several laps) until all players have passed.
4) Production phase: Players get resources according to their terraform rating and production parameters.

When the three global parameters (temperature, oxygen, ocean) have all reached their goal, the terraforming is complete, and the game ends after that generation. Count your Terraform Rating and other VPs to determine the winning corporation!
167791.name: Terraforming Mars

boardgameaccessory.220036: Terraforming Mars: Eightbitwood Player Mat Overlay

167792.name: The Day Urda Sank
167792.description:
From publisher blurb:

A spectacular story of dread and danger!

The Day Urda Sank is a world-shaking mini-campaign for Wolsung: Steampulp Fantasy that confronts Extraordinary Ladies and Gentlemen with the most hideous creatures lurking beneath the waves. Our heroes protect Lyonesse from Deep Ones, exorcise a being from out of time and sabotage a ritual performed by Father Dagon. This epic confrontation will take our characters from flooded Lyonesse to the melting North Pole and may allow them to even save the world. What more does a great steampulp horror tale need?

In The Day Urda Sank you’ll find:

Three arcs of an epic steampulp horror adventure that can take one session each:
The doom that came to Lyonesse – an investigation in flooded capital of Alfheim with grande finale in the clock tower of Tall Tom!
On alien tides – a northbound journey in a submarine threatened by Deep Ones, kraken, time-bending technology and, worst of all, foreign agents!
The shadow over Arctic – a desperate expedition through the melting North Pole where ancient things wake and try to regain world domination!
Adventure ideas to develop the apocalyptic plot even further!
Description of The Messenger, a powerful being from out of time and space!
Rules for boarding a submarine!

167794.name: OutRun Online Edition
167794.description:
From Wikipedia,

In OutRun Online Arcade, the player navigates a car from a rear third-person perspective to race through a selection of fifteen stages. At the end of each stage, the player is presented with a fork in the road that allows the player to choose one of two stages. The left route presents an easier stage, while the right provides a greater challenge. The game times the player's performance, and passing through checkpoints award the player with extra time. Once the timer reaches zero or the player completes the race, the game ends

Source: Wikipedia, "OutRun Online Arcade", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167795.name: Power Gig: Rise Of The Six String
167795.description:
From Wikipedia,

Power Gig: Rise of the SixString is a rhythm game developed by Seven45 Studios, a sister company of First Act which produces low-cost, entry-level musical instruments.[1] While the game is similar to guitar-based games like Guitar Hero and Rock Band, Power Gig ships with a unique guitar game controller that acts as both a standalone six-stringed guitar and game controller with note-matching games. Because of the nearness of the controller and gameplay to that of a real guitar, it has attracted musicians including Eric Clapton, Dave Matthews, and Kid Rock that have shied away from music games before due to the simplicity of the button-mashing concept. The game is also distributed with the AirStrike, a drum controller that works on motion sensing. The game was shipped on October 19, 2010 for the PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360.

Source: Wikipedia, "Power Gig: Rise of the SixString", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167796.name: Power Gig Guitar Controller
167796.description:
Power Gig: Rise of the SixString ships with a unique guitar game controller that acts as both a standalone six-stringed guitar and game controller with note-matching games. Because of the nearness of the controller and gameplay to that of a real guitar, it has attracted musicians including Eric Clapton, Dave Matthews, and Kid Rock that have shied away from music games before due to the simplicity of the button-mashing concept.

Source: Wikipedia, "Power Gig: Rise of the SixString", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167797.name: Airstrike Drum Controller
167797.description:
From Wikipedia,

The game also ships with a unique drum controller, the AirStrike, that allows the player to interact with the game without contact, similar to air guitaring, making for a quieter playing experience. The crescent-shaped unit, with four sensors and a bass-drum kick pedal along with additional console control buttons, is used by placing it on the floor in front of the player. The unit senses the movements in the general areas where the sensors are located, simulating the position of drums, and is able to distinguish movement between the individual drum sticks. The unit also includes support legs to bring the sensors closer to the player to help improve movement detection.

Source: Wikipedia, "Power Gig: Rise of the SixString", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167798.name: Puzzle Bobble Live
167798.description:
User Summary

This is a puzzle game where you shoot bubbles towards the top of the screen to match up three like colored bubbles. Your “character” is from the old Bubble Bobble series, and the bubbles you break contain the various characters stuck inside.
It is listed on Xbox Marketplace as Puzzle Bobble Live!, yet the title screen is Bust-A-Move Live!

167799.name: Super Puzzle Fighter II Turbo HD Remix
167799.description:
From Wikipedia,

Super Puzzle Fighter II Turbo HD Remix is a downloadable game in the Puzzle Fighter franchise for PlayStation 3 (via PlayStation Network) and Xbox 360 (via Xbox Live Arcade). HD Remix was announced to include several graphical upgrades in the interface, character sprites, and levels.

Source: Wikipedia, "Super Puzzle Fighter II Turbo", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167800.name: Qix++
167800.description:
From Wikipedia,

Qix++ is a remake of the video game Qix. The original game was released in 1981 by Taito and the updated version was released on Xbox Live Arcade in December 2009. Along with updated graphics and special effects, Qix++ adds new game modes (including multiplayer for up to four players), new enemy types and weapons.

Source: Wikipedia, "Qix ", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167801.name: Rock Band Country Track Pack 2
167801.description:
From Wikipedia,

Rock Band Country Track Pack 2 contains 21 tracks, and was released for Xbox 360, PlayStation 3, and Wii on February 1, 2011. Unlike previously released Track Packs, the Country Track Pack 2 is based on the game engine of Rock Band 2, and all songs on the disc were exclusive to the Track Pack before being released as downloadable content on November 8, 2011. The retail disc export is compatible with Rock Band, Rock Band 2, and Rock Band 3 while the standalone DLC is only compatible with Rock Band 3.

Source: Wikipedia, "List of Rock Band track packs", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167802.name: The Rifter (Issue 67 - Aug 2014)

rpgissuearticle.205688: From the Desk of Kevin Siembieda

167802.description:
From the Publishers Blurb
The Rifter® #67 is about adventure and monsters. Plus news, coming attractions, and more.
Every issue of The Rifter® is an idea factory for players and Game Masters to generate new ideas, and find new avenues of adventure. It provides useful, ready to go, source material you can just drop into your ongoing games. A doorway to new possibilities and numerous Palladium role-playing worlds. And the many new characters, O.C.C.s, powers, magic, weapons, villains, monsters, adventures and ideas for one setting can be easily adapted to any Palladium setting. Every issue has material for Rifts® and at least 2-3 other Palladium game lines. And don’t forget, most of the material can be easily adapted for use in ANY Palladium game setting.
The Rifter® Number 67 includes:
Heroes Unlimited™ – Power Behind the Throne – by Alex Tullock. Get a glimpse at some of the true powers pulling the strings of governments and their superhumans. Spice up your Heroes Unlimited™ campaign with some political, spy and espionage elements along with supermen. Plenty of ideas for adventures, and includes NPCs and Hook, Line and Sinker adventure ideas.
Splicers® – House Pandorum: The Chaos Spreads – by Kris Tipping. House Pandorum is back, with new Gardener Biotic enhancements, unique plant creations, Template Biotics and more. Illustrated by Charles “Splicers” Walton.
Rifts® – Monsters of Africa – by Jeff Duncan. 14 new monsters to add to your Rifts® campaign. Art by Tanya J. Ramsey.
Rifts® – Outpost F279™: An Adventure – by Anthony Uyl. Looking for a fun adventure to throw at your Rifts® players? Well, here you go. Enjoy.
News, coming attractions, product descriptions and more.
Heroes Unlimited™ cover by Michael Wilson.
Art by Allen Manning, Brian Manning, Mike Mumah, Ben Rodriguez, Tanya J. Ramsey and Charles Walton.
96 pages – Cat. No. 167.

167803.name: Ditto
167803.description:
User Summary

A beautifully crafted puzzle platformer. The player controls a cat and the reflection of the cat. As long as one or the other cat is supported on their side of the screen, both the cats are supported. However if one touches a fatal obstacle you will have to replay the level.

167804.name: Untrusted
167804.description:
A meta-JavaScript adventure game by Alex Nisnevich and Greg Shuflin.

Untrusted —or— the Continuing Adventures of Dr. Eval is an exciting Meta-Javascript Adventure Game wherein you guide the dashing, steadfast Dr. Eval through a mysterious MACHINE CONTINUUM, wherein, using only his trusty computer and the TURING-COMPLETE power of Javascript, he must literally ALTER HIS REALITY in order to find his freedom! You must literally edit and re-execute the very Javascript running the game in your browser to save Dr. Eval from this dark and confusing reality!

Overview

The game presents you with a roguelike-like playing environment and a console window with the JavaScript code generating each level. As loaded, each level is unbeatable, and most of the JavaScript is blocked from editing. The challenge is to open a path to the next level using only the limited tools left open to you.

Source: The Developer Website.

167805.name: Where is my Beard?
167805.description:
User Summary

Did you know beards are contagious? Drop the bearded head onto other non-bearded objects to beard them all. Some object are fixed in place, and some can be placed and manipulated as you see fit in this physics puzzler.

167806.name: No-one Has To Die
167806.description:
User Summary

A delivery person gets winds up in the control room of a burning building. Only he has access to the controls. But to contain the fire and save lives, lives must be lost. It is up to the player to choose what doors to lock, what switches to pull and tell the people where to move. Inevitably someone will die each level, but with too many deaths you will have to try again.

167807.name: Scene It? Movie Night
167807.description:
User Summary

Scene It? Movie Night is a movie trivia showdown game packed with clips from classic favorites and big box-office blockbusters.

167808.name: The Serious Sam Collection
167808.description:
User Summary

The Serious Sam Collection is a compilation game released in July 12, 2013 in UK and July 16, 2013. It comes with 4
titles that were available previously as down loadable titles: Serious Sam HD: The First Encounter, Serious Sam HD: The Second Encounter, Serious Sam 3: BFE along with The Jewel of the Nile DLC and Serious Sam Double D XXL. All 4 titles have achievement support.

167809.name: World Series Of Poker: Full House Pro
167809.description:
From Wikipedia,

World Series of Poker: Full House Pro is a video game poker variant Texas hold 'em developed by Pipeworks Software, published by Microsoft Games Studios for Xbox 360 as an Xbox Live Arcade title and Windows 8. The game is the sequel to Full House Poker using the World Series of Poker license. The game was released globally on September 4, 2013.

Source: Wikipedia, "World Series of Poker: Full House Pro", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167810.name: Voltron: Defender Of The Universe
167810.description:
From Wikipedia,

Voltron: Defender of the Universe is a twin stick shooter adventure game based on the Voltron television series, developed by Behaviour Interactive and published by THQ. The game was released on November 29, 2011 for the PlayStation Network and released on November 30, 2011 for the Xbox Live Arcade. The game allows players to play as all five lions from the series and to control Voltron, a huge robot formed by combining those lions. The game received mixed reception among critics. Some reviewers were critical of the Voltron robot gameplay sequences, yet others praised the lion sequences. Most critics spoke highly of the fan service given.

Source: Wikipedia, "Voltron: Defender of the Universe (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167811.name: Neo Geo X
167811.description:
The Neo Geo X is a handheld video game console manufactured by Tommo Inc., licensed by SNK Playmore and the latest console released as part of the company's Neo Geo brand. Information about the Neo Geo X was first reported in January 2012 and later confirmed in March. It is the first Neo Geo system to be released since the discontinuation of the brand in 2004 and the third Neo Geo handheld device, following the 1999 release of the Neo Geo Pocket Color, which was supported until 2001.

The system was released on December 18, 2012 as part of a bundle called the "Neo Geo X Gold Limited Edition", which includes a docking station, an arcade stick, and a bonus game card. The docking station is modelled after the original Neo Geo AES console and is used for charging the handheld as well as connecting it to a television. The arcade stick is a replica of the original Neo Geo AES arcade stick that can be used as a controller when the handheld is connected to a TV through the docking station.

It features games that were on the original Neo Geo AES/MVS hardware and comes built-in with 20 original Neo Geo games. Additional titles are available on game cards.

Source: Wikipedia, "Neo Geo X", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167812.description:
Guspira is a funny, quick and suitable board game for all ages, inspired on the world of fire, devils, beasts and everything related to a ‘correfoc’, one of the most gorgeous and spectacular fests of the Catalan culture. Among the game cards there are some characteristic elements of this celebration as ‘Drac’, ‘Víbria’, ‘Guita’, Devils or ‘Tabalers’, without forgetting ‘correfocaires’, brave people who jump and dance under the fire.

The main objective is to win the maximum number of ‘correfocaires’ playing the pyrotechnic cards from the hand. But it is not always as easy as it seems to be, the dice has also its role…

Besides the playful side, Guspira is expected to be a way of promotion for the Catalan culture. The cards show the most characteristic elements of this celebration and they have no text in order to be played anywhere in the world.
167812.name: Guspira, el joc dels correfocs

167813.name: Elite Encounters: Roleplaying in the Elite Universe

rpg.26070: Elite Encounters: Roleplaying in the Elite Universe

167813.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher Blurb:

The Elite Encounters Rulebook will be a single-edition book containing everything you will need to organise and play a roleplaying game in the setting of the Elite universe.

It will be available in a variety of formats, both electronic and hardcopy.

Contents

Although the final contents of the book have not yet been set in stone, the general content will be:

Character Generation Rules, including blank character sheets, ship stats and ship record sheets
Gameplay Rules, including a single page (pullout) rules summary
Miniatures Rules, including card model miniatures, measuring devices for movement and combat and card model 6-sided dice
Background information on the Elite Universe
Character and NPC Templates
3 Sample Adventures, including pregenerated player characters, set in a region developed specifically for the RPG and featured in the computer game Elite: Dangerous!
If we can fit any more content into the book then we will!

Illustrations

The book will be richly illustrated using the work of a variety of people. Frontier Developments PLC have made their catalogue of Elite: Dangerous concept art available and will allow the use of in-game footage from Alpha and Beta builds of the game prior to the full release.

In addition Daftworks will be creating custom artwork and an independent artist will be providing illustrations.

Developed in Collaboration with Frontier

The RPG will be developed in close association with Frontier Developments PLC, allowing the author unprecedented access to the resources of the computer game that forms the foundation for this book. The universe of Elite is broad and detailed and Frontier themselves are creating huge amounts of background and history for their new game - Daftworks have exclusive early access to this information as well as having a small part in providing background material and being involved with creating a "writer's bible" for the authors releasing books with Elite: Dangerous.

This means that we are on the front line for any background information that is developed, and as much of that as possible will be included in the book.

Due to this collaboration we are hoping to add more rich content, including:

World Guide for selected gameplay area of space
Map of the Core systems for each organisation
Large-scale map of the galaxy

167816.name: WeyKick Minigolf 280
167816.description: You no longer have to wait for good weather now, because with WeyKick Mini Golf the beloved sport comes into the house. With the help of a club, the ball must be put in the with as few attempts. For 1-5 players. Includes an attractive wooden game field with 5 distinct minigolf holes, 1 stainless steel club, 2 stainless steel balls, and one scorepad. (Adapted from the publisher's description.)

167817.name: Godzilla Unleashed: Double Smash
167817.description:
From Wikipedia,

The Nintendo DS version of Unleashed, Double Smash features gameplay akin to a side-scroller, similar to that of the Godzilla: Monster of Monsters. Although graphically 3D, its 2D gameplay could be said to make the game 2.5D, much like in New Super Mario Bros. or Sonic Rush. Using the two-screen display of the Nintendo DS, flying monsters appear on the top screen, while grounded monsters appear on the bottom screen. A multi-player option will allow for a different player to control each monster.

Source: Wikipedia, "Godzilla: Unleashed", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167818.name: Black Stories: Ärztlicher Rat
167818.description: Black Stories: Ärztlicher Rat is a promotional card celebrating the tenth anniversary of Black Stories. The card was given out for free at SPIEL 2014 in Essen as an advance publication from Black Stories 11.

167819.description:
This is a Medieval Academy expansion. These variants require the Medieval Academy game. All the basic rules apply except for the modifications described in the rules that come with this expansion. You can play in the same time with as many variants as you want.

This expansion is a single board with 'Gallantry' on one side and 'Magic' on the other.

Gallantry Board
In disc’s order on the Gallantry side of the board, each squire chooses and applies one or two bonus. He places his disc on chosen bonuses,in order to make those bonus unavailable for the others squires. On less than 4 squires games, only first and second squires earn bonus.

Magic Board
As on Gallantry board, on Magic board, squires don’t directly win Chivalry points, but Magic board allows them to move forward on any board. On scoring, (turns 2 and 5, after Gallantry scoring), only the 3 first ranked squires (or the 2 first ranked in 3 players games) earn cases bonus; they could move forward their own discs by a number of cases according to their position on Magic board. The move can be split on one or several boards.

Move order:
1)First, the 3rd ranked squire on Magic board.
2)After the 2nd ranked squire on Magic board.
3)Finally, the first ranked squire on Magic board.

There is a reminder on the top of the Magic board:
At the end of Turn 2, after the scoring phase, all the discs go back to square 0 on Magic board.
167819.name: Medieval Academy: Expansion «Galanttry» and «Magic»

167820.description: New cards make POOP playable for up to 10 players! All new Wild Cards! POOP is an UNO-like game where the first player to run out of cards wins! Take turns pooping but don't clog the toilet! Some cards make players perform crazy acts.
167820.name: Poop: The Game – The Expansion Deck

167821.name: Stack Tac Toe
167821.description: Rack 'em up and stack 'em up with this multi-level version that's tic tac terrific! The objective is still to get 3 in a row horizontally or diagonally - the new challenge is to get 3 in a row vertically too. Develops problem-solving, logical thinking and spatial awareness.

167822.description:
An add-on during Draco Magi's Kickstarter campaign, you received 2 copies of the Celestial Dragon and 1 alternate art "The Lake" battlefield card.

These will be available through CoolStuffInc

Celestial Dragon's Text:
At the start of melee, the Celestial Dragon allows you to discard up to 3 battle cards and draw an equal number of new battle cards
167822.name: Draco Magi: Celestial Dragon and Alternate Art The Lake Promo Cards

167824.name: Uruk II: Promokarte Plünderung

164027.name: Uruk II: Die Entwicklung Geht Weiter

167824.description: The achievement Card Plundering introduces a new color: black

167825.description:
Clash of Cultures: Civilizations - Aztecs is an additional civilization for the game Clash of Cultures and its first expansion Clash of Cultures: Civilizations, consisting of three Leader cards and a Civilization board.

It was available in 2014 as a promotional item at the Z-MAN Games (English version) and Filosofia Édition (French version) booths at the game trade fair "Internationale Spieltage SPIEL" in Essen.
167825.name: Clash of Cultures: Civilizations – Aztecs

167827.description:
Butim (Spoil, in portuguese) is a competitive pirate game where players compete with each other for the best equipment, pieces of maps and hidden treasures. It's a party game of luck and strategy where you will cheat, steal, bother and disrupt the lives of your opponents. There is no honor among pirates! There is no elimination, that is, who enters the game stays until the end and everyone has a chance to win.

Butim is a card game that tells the story of the Bloody Islands Archipelago. These islands were used by generations of pirates to hide the biggest secrets that sailed the 7 seas. But all the pirates who buried their treasures there, also armed the most terrible traps so that these treasures stay properly protected. It was a beautiful and deadly place. However, as every story has an end, on a beautiful day a mysterious maelstrom opened near the islands and is leaching the islands with all this wealth to the bottom of the ocean. The objective of the game is to remove as many treasures as possible from these islands before they vanish forever. The player who has more wealth at the end of the game is declared the winner.

During the game you draw resources and cards, dig the islands (draw island cards) looking for maps and treasures and play special cards. At the end of a round cards are removed from the islands to the maelstrom. The game ends when a number of islands were totally removed.
167827.name: Butim

boardgameimplementation.37380: Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age

boardgamecompilation.150926: Roll Through the Ages: The Iron Age

167828.description:
Roll Through the Ages: The Iron Age, a sequel to the highly-awarded Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age, lets you build an Iron Age civilization in under an hour! Do you build provinces, raise armies, and conquer barbarians or build ports and ships to gain trade goods? Explore the strategies of Greece, Phoenicia, and Rome as you erect monuments, fend off disasters, and strive to feed your people.

Roll Through the Ages: The Iron Age gives players different ways to build their empires: the Trade and Naval strategies of the Phoenicians, the conquests of Alexander the Great, and the engineering prowess and gradual absorption of new provinces by the Roman Republic.

Some copies of the game include the Roll Through the Ages: The Iron Age – The Mediterranean Expansion in the base game box. The only indication of this was a sticker on the shrink that read "MED expansion".

The Mediterranean expansion adds overseas settlements to the mix via a central pegboard that all players share. Players race to reap the benefits of strategic colonies: Crete for fleets; Spain for mining; Carthage for wheat; Gaul for armies; while Syracuse, the home of Archimedes, and Alexandria provide vital innovations.

The Mediterranean expansion is not available separately. Eagle Games has implied that this might change in the future.
167828.name: Roll Through the Ages: The Iron Age with Mediterranean Expansion

boardgameaccessory.170050: Roll Through the Ages: Iron Age – Fate Dice

167829.name: Merry Christmas! The Hand-Drafting Card Game
167829.description:
You are a member of HOHOHO – the Helping Out & Happiness Optimization Holiday Organization - an elite group of elves operating out of Santa’s North Pole Headquarters. Your mission, if you choose to accept it, is to help Santa bring joy to all the good girls and boys. You’ll coordinate the efforts of busy workshop elves, powerful flying reindeers, and even the big man himself. Take the right actions and you’ll bring joy to the world and ensure that everyone has a Merry Christmas!

Each player drafts a hand of twelve actions, ten of which will be played throughout the game's three phases. Elves are used in the Workshop Phase to craft toys from the list. Reindeer are used during the Sleigh Phase to ensure the toys are delivered to excited children. Items are placed in the Tree Phase to elevate the atmosphere of joy and wonder. Santa makes frequent appearances throughout the game, offering his help along the way. As Christmas comes to a close, players are scored based on the toys delivered and the joy those toys inspire.

167830.name: ir/rational Redux
167830.description:
User Summary

A series of logic puzzles (propositional calculus). You must pick the correct statement to fill in the missing line of a series of statements to create a rational argument. It doesn't need to be correct, the argument must simply be rational.

167831.name: The Physicist
167831.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the third installment of the Advancing with Class series. This supplement focuses on a brand new class: The Physicist. A spell caster like no other, with the ability to spontaneously become stronger, more enduring, or more agile as well as pass these enhancments off to others.

Why should only the more intellectual or spirital characters have access to casting magic spells? What if you could use your Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution to power your own set of magics? The Physicist is a new class that allows your character to focus on one of his physical attributes to empower magics to give the party the edge when it comes to dealing with more powerful creatures.

Sure, you can’t cast a Fireball, but who needs to when you have the strength of a Giant or the indomitable spirit of a Dragon? And not only that, you can share this power with your friends and allies.

Included is the Physicist class, a Psionic version of the Physicist, several archetypes, new spells, and feats. Welcome to the magics of Physic!

167832.name: Haunted Mansion
167832.description:
From publisher blurb:

It never was the same after the Earl died. The Mansion lay empty and abandoned... except for strange sounds and lights in the night

Haunted Mansion is a printable dungeon floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Haunted Mansion is a multiple level set, comprising 4 battlemaps. The main map features a large stone mansion, with dusty and cobwebbed furniture. Stairs lead down to the cellar where a you are as likely to find a coffin as you are barrels. Upstairs are bedrooms, mysterious blood stains and moonlight, and another set of stairs lead to the attic.

Haunted Mansion is ideal for countless adventures. If you're planning a Halloween or Horror story, your adventurers can see if the stories of a Haunting are true. Vampires, ghouls and ghosts are just a few of the denizens you may encounter in the Haunted Mansion.

. Also included is a set of 300dpi full size jpgs, for poster printing or VTT.

167833.name: Missing Mythic Magic Volume XI
167833.description:
From publisher blurb:

Uncover Forgotten Arcane Lore!

Everyone knows that knowledge is power, and that having options is better than not having them. It should come as no surprise, then, that wizards, witches, and other powerful spellcasters are always on the lookout for new and exciting spells to add to their repertoires. While many spells from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook received a facelift and an upgrade in Mythic Adventures, the sourcebook that introduced mythic power to the game of Pathfinder, dozens of spells were left behind. Missing Mythic Magic Volume XI, and its predecessors, aim to give each and every spell from the core rules a full-fledged mythic upgrade, all the way from A to Z, with a special focus on making mythic spells that feel as over-the-top and larger-than-life as possible.

This installment includes 20 mythic spells, from heroes’ feast to imprisonment. A mythic hide from animals can ward an entire area against animals, rather than affecting individuals, and expands the spell to work on magical beasts, plants, oozes, and vermin. A mythic hold person can be rendered permanent (if the DC is high enough), effectively paralyzing the victim indefinitely, while a mythic horrid wilting causes the desiccated corpses of those that it slays to rise a mummies under the caster’s control. This tome contains all that, and much, much more!

167834.name: You Must Escape (Web Browser)
167834.description:
User Summary

You Must Escape is a game where you are locked in a room, and must find your way out. However the lights are turned off and you must use the sound your footsteps make and the louder sound you make with the space bar. These send soundwaves traveling out that you can see represented by white lines on the screen. Things are easy at first, but then you will see red lines bouncing back at you denoting danger. It might be a simple stationary trap, or it could be a creature hunting you. But beware, if you can "see" the creature by making noise, that means the creature has heard you too!

167836.description:
This pre-printed map for Settlers of Catan depicts the peninsula of Spain and Portugal.

The game is played using the normal Settler rules and components, with a few additional rules printed on the map. That rules differ if 3-4 players or 5-6 players are playing.

Also playable with 2 players if combined with Catan: Traders & Barbarians
167836.name: Die Siedler von Catan: Hispania Edition

167839.description:
Two promo character cards for King's Pouch:

The Painter gives victory points depending on the number of citizen colors in the active area.
The Physician assumes the role of any other character during the Great Council.
167839.name: King's Pouch: Painter & Physician Promos

167840.description:
This upgrade pack contains all the upgraded components from the second edition of the game, for owners of the first (Z-Man Games) edition. Both the component quality and the graphics have been upgraded:

New central board
New player score boards for all four factions
New tokes for units for all four factions
New flare cards
New task cards
167840.name: Tash-Kalar: Arena of Legends – The Upgrade Pack

167841.description:
The Hochzeitsturm (Wedding Tower) is a new tile to replace the desert tile. If a 7 is rolled the usual rule applies but also every player with a settlement or city next to the Hochzeitsturm gains one resource of where the robber is placed.

It is part of a die-cut sheet, 20 Jahre Darmstadt Spielt. To mark his 20th anniversary the play group "Spielekreis Darmstadt" published a die-cut sheet with mini expansions to five popular games:

• Carcassonne
• Hugo, das Schlossgespenst (aka: Midnight Party)
• Die Siedler von Catan (aka: The Settlers of Catan)
• Village Port
• Zooloretto

The die-cut sheet was sold during the event "Darmstadt plays" from Nov. 15 through 16, 2014 and before that at the fair "Spiel" in Essen from Oct. 16 through 19, 2014 at the magazine "Spielerei".
167841.name: Die Siedler von Catan: Hochzeitsturm

167842.description:
A set of 6 special cards and a rule sheet with a 2-player variant for the game.

There is one special card for 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 and 8 of a kind. A player who plays down any of these combinations, may take that card (or steal it from another player). Each card is worth 5 points at game end.

The rules sheet offers a "Duel" variant for two players.
167842.name: Abluxxen: Sonderkarten / Duell

167843.description:
Promo card Monarchy from the german magazine "Spielerei" issue no. 105 (Oct.-Dec. 2014)
The achievement Monarchy has a new edge with black color. It is the only achievement of level 5. No black card may be replaced by an achievement. Black cards are not immune from the effects of disasters. In addition to a black card no settlement can be set because the resources are not available. The favor of Nergal does not help on black cards. However, it is possible to set settlements in front of black cards by using the "scale". A black card can replace an achievement that has upside a village or town. Black cards don't count as a color within the meaning of the condition of civilization cards (eg. "disease").
To play a black card, the player needs either more black cards or a corresponding number of color pairs or the favor Nannars. Playing "monarchy" also has to be considered the rule of stages, ie it must already be an achievement of level 4.

Function of the Monarchy promo-card:
With the promo card "monarchy" lying ahead the player receives one additional victory point.
167843.name: Uruk II: Promokarte Monarchie

164027.name: Uruk II: Die Entwicklung Geht Weiter

167844.description:
The A Call to Arms Rules Supplement series brings you an array of new rules, information, articles and ships. It is an invaluable resource for any A Call to Arms player and will change the way you play your games!

Within Supplement 1 you will find wide variety of new articles designed to expand and develop the way you play A Call to Arms. Whether it is new rules for incorporating hyperspace and space stations, advanced fighter combat, or an in-depth study of the Centauri Maximus frigate, you will find something to get your teeth into. Scenarios and campaigns haven't been forgotten either, and you will find and exciting Raider campaign ready to run as well! With the Second Battle of Quadrant 14 scenario plus updates of those in the main rulebook, Supplement 1 is packed with great additions for A Call to Arms!
167844.name: A Call to Arms Rules Supplement 1

13455.name: A Call to Arms: Babylon 5 Space Combat

167845.description:
The A Call to Arms Rules Supplement series brings you an array of new rules, information, articles and ships. It is an invaluable resource for any A Call to Arms player and will change the way you play your games!

Within Supplement 3 you will find wide variety of new articles designed to expand and develop the way you play A Call to Arms. With complete fleet listings for the Vree Conglomerate ande the aggressive Drazi Freehold as well as a scenario pitting the Army of Light against the Vorlons, plus massively expanded Refit tables, A Call to Arms Rules Supplement 3 is not to be missed!
167845.name: A Call to Arms Rules Supplement 3

13455.name: A Call to Arms: Babylon 5 Space Combat

167846.name: Drive on Baghdad: 2003
167846.description:
Drive on Baghdad: 2003 is a solitaire game in which the player takes command of Central Command Forces during Operation Iraqi Freedom. Your goal is to defeat Saddam Hussein’s forces in such a manner as to prevent a post-campaign insurgency from breaking out.

The system plays the Iraqis. You will have to deal with a variety of situations, such as: battling Republican Guard divisions, safeguarding your lines of supply, sandstorms, etc., all the while keeping up the momentum in your drive on Baghdad.

The game has two levels: Standard Rules, which give a quick-play game, and the Optional Rules, which add more realism at the expense of increased complexity.

While this is a solitaire game, more than one can play as a team, making decisions by consensus, or with different players managing operations along each vector of Advance.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 176 counters

Modern War #20 - Nov Dec 2015

167847.name: Lamp and Vamp
167847.description:
User Summary

You are a vampire, trying to reach your coffin in this roguelike game. You can move one hexagon a turn. But beware, so do the humters move a hexagon a turn. Stay in the shadows. If the light the hunters make reaches you, they will chase you down. If you are next to a hunter though, and in the shadows you can bite them. Bite them a second time to drink their blood and regain health. You can also turn into a bat or fog. They allow you to pass through objects and the fog allows you to disappear and even pass through enemies. These cost health however. Each round the damage or health gained previously carries over. Each round you can select one upgrade.

167848.description:
Hyperborea Promo is a promotional mini-expansion that includes four cards:

Long Journey(Deck I)
Extorsion (Deck II)
Proselytism (Deck III)
Tyranny (Deck IV)




Also included is an additional central hexagon tile, showing an island with two gold ruins.

This promotional pack has been distributed with copies bought during Essen Spiel 2014.
167848.name: Hyperborea: Promo Set

167849.description:
Ring of Favor is a promotional mini-expansions for Alchemists. It consists of a single artifact card, with the following text:





Ring of Favor (Artifact - Cost 4 - VP 2)



You can double the effect of a favor card you play. Limit once per round.




It was distributed with the game during Essen Spiel 2014, Cannes 2015, and the 2015 Dice Tower Kickstarter.
167849.name: Alchemists: Ring of Favor

167850.name: Zombie Mania!
167850.description: Zombie Mania is zombie fighting board game for kids, where players try to get rid of the zombies who have invaded the building by throwing dice and getting pairs. Some combinations allow for sending zombies to another player's building.

167851.description:
Metallicus is a promotional rooster card included in Mars Needs Mechanics. It has unique art and ability and can replace one of player roosters during game setup.

The card ability reads:
At game end, this rooster can trade both of his own bronze insignia tokens for a single silver insignia of his choice, OR he may trade two silver insignia for a Caesar insignia.
167851.name: Chicken Caesar: Metallicus Promo Card

167852.name: Table Scraps Issue 3
167852.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Table Scraps, a new series of supplements for the Mutant Future role-playing game by Goblinoid Games.

Table Scraps is a three to three page supplement that will include various items for use in the Mutant Future game. This issue introduces new rules for black powder weapons, a comprehensive list of black powder weapons and bombards for your post apocalyptic pirate ships.

The PDF is book-marked and includes layers so that the backgrounds can be turned off for ease of printing.

167853.name: Throwdown at the North Pole (Savage Worlds)
167853.description:
From publisher blurb:

The workshops are closed, Santa off on his journey. But there’s no rest for the elves.
Santa’s mortal enemies, the abominable snowmen, attack each year as soon as the big man is gone. With hearts as cold as ice, they tear apart the gingerbread houses and toss theelves around, hoping to cause enough pain and destruction to ruin Christmas the following year.

But the North Pole is not defenseless. One person rallies the elves each year. One person trains with them in combat techniques and tactics. One person personally leads them in battle for one night each year to insure her husband can deliver toys to children next Christmas. That’s right; the leader of the elves is none other than Mrs. Claus, one of the most formidable holiday warriors on the planet.

This great module, written by Clint Black, is a light-hearted look at the question of what happens when Santa leaves with his sleigh and reindeer team each Christmas. Clint has provided Elf archetypes, loadouts and new weapons that will make this both fun and customizable. In addition, this module features a great new map from Fabled Enviroments.

167854.name: Double Dragon: The Revenge Of Billy Lee
167854.description:
User Summary

Double Dragon (ダブルドラゴン), known in Europe as Double Dragon: The Revenge of Billy Lee is a game that was developed and published by Virgin Interactive for the Sega Game Gear in 1993. Despite being called simply Double Dragon in the US and using promotional artwork from the first arcade game for the box art it is not a port of that game.

Despite the boxart showing both Lee brothers, only Billy is playable. Billy is out to avenge his brother whom has been killed by the Dragon Clan. In addition to standard attacks, weapons found can be used. This includes a gun, which is a unusual equippable weapon for the series and is the first time such a weapon was equippable.

167855.name: Battle of Golems: The Algorithmic Card Game
167855.description:
"Great Magician Algoritmus created Golems - - clay warriors robots - for King of Kibertania. Golems can obey Commands and perform their short sequences in a Program. The king also ordered to build for the Golem a special field where soldiers-programmers learned to control the Golems and arrange fights. You will take part in the tournament and determine which of you is the best robotics in Kibertania. "

Game overview.
This game about programming, algorithmic and battle of Golem-robots. We wanted to make a game that would allow to learn the basics of programming and robotics, and at the same time fun and entertaining time.

Who is players?
First they are children - they learn programming and the basics of robots management. Adults - it develops the mind and gives "food for thought". Teachers - now have something to take students in the classroom and in the clubs, even if no actual computers and robots. You can use a ready Scripts and develop you own rules, field and action!

The game is simple and complicated its rules possible variants simultaneously.

Game components
1-2-3-4 colored Golems, fields - 1 4x4 field and 4 field 3x3, folding in a square 6x6, and more other configuration, in which Golem can walk and tockens of Barries that complicate the game and allow you to play a variety of scenarios and solving the puzzles.

Print&Play version avalible here: https://drive.google.com/folderview?id=0BxOLQQPjjQUrWFBYNzJE...;usp=sharing

Russian description:

"Великий маг Алгоритмус по приказу короля Кибертании создал Големов - глиняных воинов-роботов. Големы могли подчиняться Командам и выполнять их короткие последовательности в виде Программы. Король также приказал построить для Големов специальное поле, на котором воины-программисты учились управлять Големами и устраивать баталии. Вам предстоит принять участие в Турнире и определить, кто из вас лучший робототехник Кибертании."

О чем эта игра? О программировании, исполнителях и просто битве Големов-роботов. Мы хотели сделать игру, которая позволила бы изучить основы программирования и робототехники, а заодно весело и занимательно провести время.

Для кого эта игра? Для детей - они учатся программированию, алгоритмике и основам управления исполнителями. Для взрослых - она развивает мышление и дает "пищу для ума". Для преподавателей - теперь есть чем занять учеников на уроках и в кружках, даже если нету компьютеров и реальных роботов. Вы можете использовать как готовые сценарии, так и придумывать свои правила, поля и действия!
Игра проста своими правилами и сложна возможными вариантами одновременно.

Что вы в ней найдете?
1-2-3-4 цветных фигурки Големов, поля - 1 поле 4x4 и 4 поля 3x3, складывающиеся как в квадрат 6x6, так и в более сложные фигуры, по которым Големы могут ходить и жетоны препятствий, который усложняют игру и позволяют разыгрывать различные сценарии и задавать головоломки.

167856.name: Colis Party
167856.description:
Try to deliver your packet as soon as possible to mailman Johnny.

Each player chooses a card (indicating means of mail delivery transport) from his hand and passes it face down to his right of left neighbour (direction is given by Johnny the mailman). When all players have a hidden card in front of them, they turn the cards at the same time. The card in front of each player indicates which combination he/she should make. They have to see how much identical cards are revealed by other players, and how much identical cards they have on their hand. This indicates on which number they have to tap (2, 3 of 4) as soon as possible. If they see 5 identical cards, they shout "timbré" (=stamped).

Players who tapped rightfully at 2, 3 of 4 can take pieces of a packet. They get 2 cards (showing parts of a postpacket) from the deck, keep 1 and discard the other one. The player who tapped the 3 can make, after choising from two cards, an additional move: steal a card from an other player. The player who could tap the 4 can choose a piece (out of two cards), steal another and gets the mailman. He/she also decides in which direction the cards are given in the next round. The players who tapped wrongfully, must discard a card from their packet.

If a player can show 5 identical cards, he shouts "timbré". He'll be the only one playing this round. He takes 5 cards from the deck, keep 1 and discard 4, steals a card and takes the mailman. The other players must discard a piece (card) of their packet.

For the next round players take the card in front of them in their hands and play a hidden card to the right or left player, as isntructed by the (new) mailman.

As soon as a player had his 6 pieces (cards) of the packet AND the mailman, he/she wins!

167857.name: Clue Chronicles: Fatal Illusion
167857.description:
From Wikipedia,

Clue Chronicles: Fatal Illusion (subtitled Mystery Series: Episode One) is a 1999 PC point-and-click adventure game based on the Cluedo franchise.

Source: Wikipedia, "Clue Chronicles: Fatal Illusion", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167858.name: Amy's Fantasies
167858.description:
User Summary

Amy's Fantasies, by Csware, has been ported over to the States by Himeya Soft. Amy's Fantasies is a comedy erotic adventure game where you play the part of Emi as she quests to find her one true love, Tomomi.

You play the part of Emi, a high-school girl with a very strong love for her younger step-brother (your father married his mother after both of you were born). She finally decides that it is time to confess her love to him, since it is near her 18th birthday. But, before the climactic moment where you can confess your love, debt collectors arrive to confiscate your fathers properties, and Tomomi goes missing! And this is where the game truly begins.
Amy's Fantasies is an Adventure game, published by Himeya, which was released in 1996. It is considered an adult or Ero game.

167860.name: Love Potion
167860.description:
User Summary

Love Potion is an adult adventure game, developed by C's Ware. You find yourself investigating a series of disappearances at an all-girls school. During the investigation Adult situations arise while you try to discover what is going on within the school.

167862.name: Paradise Heights
167862.description:
User Summary

Paradise Heights is a point-and-click adult bishoujo adventure game. It is a linear game, there's only one path to the story and its impossible to lose. Player is in role of Keigo Nakadai, a 25 year old average guy who makes his living doing odd jobs. Now he's got a job as a caretaker of a top class apartment block where all the residents are women...

167863.name: Season Of The Sakura
167863.description:
From Wikipedia,

The player controls Shuji Yamagami, a Japanese high school student, over the course of a Japanese school year from April to March. The game is played by reading through text and selecting actions for Shuji to perform.

Source: Wikipedia, "Season of the Sakura", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167865.name: The Very Organized Thief
167865.description:
User Summary

You spawn the game in a house not belonging to you, with nothing but a torch and a checklist of things to "borrow". You only have a few minutes to grab what you can from the list before the owner gets home. You can play it safe and grab a few things, or try to outrun the owner in their own house and grab as much as possible. The location of some items move from game to game and the checklist changes.

167868.name: Sega Smash Pack
167868.description:
From Wikipedia,

The first Sega Smash Pack was released in 1999 for the PC. It featured eight games.

Altered Beast
Columns
Golden Axe
Out Run
Phantasy Star II
Sonic Spinball
The Revenge of Shinobi
Vectorman

Source: Wikipedia, "Sega Smash Pack", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167869.name: Sega Smash Pack 2
167869.description:
From Wikipedia,

The second Sega Smash Pack, known as Sega Smash Pack 2, was another PC game and was released in 2000. It featured eight games.

Comix Zone
Flicky
Kid Chameleon
Sega Swirl
Shining Force
Sonic the Hedgehog 2
Super Hang-On
Vectorman 2

Source: Wikipedia, "Sega Smash Pack", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167870.name: Pause Ahead
167870.description:
User Summary

A challenging platformer game with lots of traps and saws and obstacles and pits and spikes. But this game has a twist. You can pause time. While time is paused you keep your momentum, and are invulnerable to threats. But when you unpause time if you are on or above on obstacle that will kill you, you won't be long for the world. Oh, and there is a time limit too. And you only have a limited number of pauses that you can utilize.

167871.name: Sonic & Knuckles Collection
167871.description:
From Wikipedia,

Sonic & Knuckles Collection is a Sonic the Hedgehog compilation game for Microsoft Windows-based PCs, released in 1997.[2]
This collection includes:
Sonic the Hedgehog 3
Sonic & Knuckles
Sonic 3 & Knuckles
Blue Sphere

Source: Wikipedia, "Compilations in the Sonic series", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167873.name: Three Sisters Story
167873.description:
From Wikipedia,

Three Sisters' Story (三姉妹 Sanshimai, Three Sisters) is a adult bishōjo visual novel for the PC by Sakura Soft. It was translated to English by JAST USA.

The gameplay is standard for a visual novel. The player reads text at the bottom of the screen, which is accompanied by static images. A number of choices are made during the course of the game, letting the player direct the main character through the plot, and into sexual encounters with Yuki, Emi or Risa, the three main female characters, as well as with a number of other females.

Source: Wikipedia, "Three Sisters' Story", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167874.name: Galaxy of Trian: Expand the Galaxy

167875.name: Ultra Vixen
167875.description:
User Summary

One day Ariel, an ordinary schoolgirl, is left after the classes by her biology teacher. The teacher, a pervert, as every girl in the school seems to know, seduces Ariel. While he does it, he is transformed into the Overlord, a creature who seduces and tortures girls and young women. She gains powers and creates a portal to try to stop the Overlord by using adult situations to destroy his influence through WWII Germany, present time Tokyo subway train and distant future.

167876.name: Xena Warrior Princess: Girls Just Want To Have Fun
167876.description:
From Wikipedia,

Girls Just Wanna Have Fun is also the title of a multipath adventure game by Slingshot Entertainment which is based upon this episode.

Source: Wikipedia, "Girls Just Wanna Have Fun (Xena)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167877.description:
Stretch Rewards for the New Dawn Kickstarter Campaign of July 2014:

A First Player Resin Miniature Marker
A new race, The Ludons consisting of a player board and 8 Technology cards

Pack of 34 Cards (See Note 1)
- 1 Spiel 2014 Card
- 2 Phase A Economic Facilities
- 2 Phase A Scientific Facilities
- 2 Phase A Military Facilities
- 2 Phase A Hostile Facilities
- 2 Phase B Economic Facilities
- 2 Phase B Scientific Facilities
- 2 Phase B Military Facilities
- 2 Phase B Hostile Facilities
- 2 Green Base Benefits (See Note 2)
- 3 Stations
- 3 Alliance Aid Cards
- 9 Events Cards

Note 1 - The cards have the same expansion code (ND) as the New Dawn Base Game.

Note 2 - The Base Benefit Cards have the code for Station (ST) instead of the correct (BB).
167877.name: New Dawn: Bonus Game Material

167878.name: Quick Backgammon
167878.description:
Quick Backgammon is two games in one box. The first game is QuickGammon, a scaled down variant of backgammon that has fewer pieces and fewer points on the board, and uses d4 dice. Quickgammon is an introductory game to teach children and beginners the principles of backgammon.

Also included in the box is a standard backgammon board, and the game includes d6 dice and enough pieces to play the standard game.

[User summary from game box and rules.]

167879.name: Shybot
167879.description:
User Summary

A demanding retro platforming game with a Chiptunes soundtrack, Gameboy Color palette, save points, bosses, and a sense of humor, Robot is tired of being picked on so it leaves for the World of Solitude.

167880.name: Lejends Magazine (Volume 1, Issue 1 - May 2001)
167880.description:
From the cover:

Within the Scroll:

Laws of the Realms: An Open Discussion
Lost Lore: New Psychogenic Powers
New Orders: The Alchemist, The Merchant, The Scholar
The Star Chamber: Welcome to the LA (TM) Game Multiverse
Out of the Wilderness

167881.name: Atum
167881.description:
ATUM pulls the player into a world where the player is the mechanic. It brings a novelty take on the point-and-click gameplay of previous generations and combines it with platformer puzzles. The game toys with the concept of multi-layer gameplay, dipping its layers in mathematical loops and philosophical recurrences.

The design and the aesthetics are influenced by a manifold of science fiction classics, Blade Runner and Philip K. Dick's story Martian Time Slip among others.

The game environment, used as narrative device, provides a considerable amount of references and clues that complement the underlying storyline.

ATUM has been developed by a group of 3rd year students at NHTV IGAD, The Netherlands as part of the University's Gamelab, a one-day-a-week workshop that simulates a development studio environment. The team, consisting of an average of 10 members, worked on this project for 42 days.

"You Are Here, reads the legend on that map. Which one is you? Does it matter? Your finger is a pointer on a screen."
-Gene Van Troyer

Source: The Game Website.

167882.name: The Zombie
167882.description:
The Zombie is a micro-game of cunning and bluff. Taking the concept of the famous Werewolf game (Mafia), the game features some child trying to escape a zombie invasion.

Players receive a card at the start of the round and they try to eliminate the "right" player depending on their role. Players will vote each round trying to "survive" as long as possible.

The Zombie is a fast game (about 5 minutes) of bluffing and deception, it’s the perfect «filler» for any group. The game contains only 4 cards and it take less than 1 minute to explain. The game is easy to transport, does not take space and can be played almost anywhere; in queues, in a bar, in the car, during a break.

167883.description: Bring the power of the dark side to life with Imperial Assault Villain Packs! The General Weiss Villain Pack contains a sculpted plastic figure that can be constructed as either a standard AT-ST, or General Weiss’s heavily modified assault walker. What’s more, you’ll find new missions for both the Imperial Assault campaign game and the skirmish game, inviting you to investigate an Imperial research lab or lead the Rebels into a deadly forest ambush. With new missions, a plastic figure, and key Command cards, this Villain Pack expands your sinister machinations in any game of Imperial Assault.
167883.name: Star Wars: Imperial Assault – General Weiss Villain Pack

167884.description: Bring the power of the dark side to life with Imperial Assault Villain Packs! The Royal Guard Champion Villain Pack contains a sculpted plastic figure to replace the token found in the Imperial Assault Core Set, depicting a fearsome champion of the Emperor’s Royal Guard. Even besides this figure, you’ll find new missions for both the Imperial Assault campaign and skirmish games, inviting you to attempt a data heist in a Kuat space station or trap the Rebels as they attempt to upload a virus to Imperial networks. With new missions, a detailed plastic figure, and key Command cards, this Villain Pack expands your sinister machinations in any game of Imperial Assault
167884.name: Star Wars: Imperial Assault – Royal Guard Champion Villain Pack

167885.description: Bring the power of the dark side to life with Imperial Assault Villain Packs! The IG-88 Villain Pack contains a sculpted plastic figure to replace the token found in the Imperial Assault Core Set, depicting the renowned Droid assassin. In addition to this detailed figure, you’ll find new missions for both the Imperial Assault campaign game and the skirmish game, inviting you to enter the shifting junkyards of Ord Mantell or raise an army of Droids to rebel against the tyranny of the biologicals. With new missions, a detailed plastic figure, and key Command cards, this Villain Pack expands your sinister machinations in any game of Imperial Assault.
167885.name: Star Wars: Imperial Assault – IG-88 Villain Pack

167886.description: Fight for the Rebel Alliance with Imperial Assault Ally Packs! The Chewbacca Ally Pack features a detailed figure of Chewbacca, allowing you to replace the ally token found in the Core Set, and bring new life to this fearless Wookiee smuggler. You’ll also discover new missions for both the campaign game and the skirmish game, allowing you to prevent the Empire from enslaving Wookiees on Kashyyyk, or infiltrate an Imperial labor camp. With new missions, a plastic figure, and key Command cards, this Ally Pack offers plenty of options for any game of Imperial Assault.
167886.name: Star Wars: Imperial Assault – Chewbacca Ally Pack

167887.description: Fight for the Rebel Alliance with Imperial Assault Ally Packs! The Rebel Troopers Ally Pack features three detailed figures of Rebel troopers, allowing you to replace the tokens found in the Core Set, and bring the soldiers of the Rebellion to the battlefields of Imperial Assault. You’ll also uncover new missions for both the campaign game and the skirmish game, allowing you to battle within a Geonosis foundry, or fight to download critical data before the Rebel troopers’ position is overrun. With new missions, plastic figures, and key Command cards, this Ally Pack offers plenty of options for any game of Imperial Assault.
167887.name: Star Wars: Imperial Assault – Rebel Troopers Ally Pack

167888.description: Fight for the Rebel Alliance with Imperial Assault Ally Packs! The Rebel Saboteurs Ally Pack features two detailed figures of Rebel saboteurs, allowing you to replace the tokens found in the Core Set, and bring some of the Rebellion’s most destructive agents to the battlefields of Imperial Assault. You’ll find new missions for both the campaign game and the skirmish game, allowing you to bushwhack through the wilderness of Endor, or help the saboteurs destroy an important prototype starship. With new missions, plastic figures, and key Command cards, this Ally Pack offers plenty of options for any game of Imperial Assault.
167888.name: Star Wars: Imperial Assault – Rebel Saboteurs Ally Pack

167889.description: Fight for the Rebel Alliance with Imperial Assault Ally Packs! The Han Solo Ally Pack features a detailed figure of Han Solo, allowing you to replace the ally token found in the Core Set, and bring the cunning scoundrel to life. You’ll also discover new missions for both the campaign game and the skirmish game, allowing you to repel boarders from the Millennium Falcon, or take your chances with the Corellian underworld. With new missions, a plastic figure, and key Command cards, this Ally Pack offers plenty of options for any game of Imperial Assault.
167889.name: Star Wars: Imperial Assault – Han Solo Ally Pack

167890.name: Castles & Crusades Black Box Collectors Edition
167890.description:
publisher blurb

Ten years ago we launched Castles & Crusades the RPG. We officially debuted the game at Gencon with a collectors set designed after the original white box of Dungeons & Dragons. We did this to celebrate that game's 30th anniversary.


Ten years later the game is growing stronger and faster than ever and we are happily celebrating our 10th anniversary.


To bring it in properly we present to you the 4010 Collectors Edition of Castles & Crusades, the Black Box. 10 years of C&C. 40 years of D&D. Its a wonderful world.
There are only 1000 printed.
The first 300 are signed and numbered.
