Within are 3 books, 10 dice (four d6's with Castles and Crusades replacing the number 6), a small bit of company history, three cards that trace the evolution of the original company logo. These are all signed by the creators of TLG and C&C: Stephen Chenault, Davis Chenault and Mac Golden.



The three books:
Adventurer's Backpack: Four new classes: The Archer, Avatar, Magic User and Thief. Original takes on old classes! Each of the new classes is fully detailed and playable out of the box. These are followed by four ready made adventurer's backpacks, with equipment cataloged and stored, with cost and EV attached. These are followed by 36+ spells, all new, all ready to hit your table right now!


Of Gods & Monsters of Aihrde: Details on 16 or more gods, 5 giants, 5 eldritch goblins, 4 fiends and one of the Captain Kings. Each entry places the god or monster squarely in the world of Aihrde, fully playable with adventure hooks. But these are no ordinary giants and fiends. The giants are named as are the goblins, each with their own sorry tale. The fiends are wholly new to C&C, designed to aid CKs who need to bring characters to their senses!


The Golden Familiar: Revised and expanded. This adventure originally appeared as an add on with the portrait screens. Now we've cleaned it up and added 14 maps. The adventure pitches the characters a hill top castle whose 14 gates guard the only access to the treasure within.

167891.name: Thief Town
167891.description:
There Be Thieves In These Parts

Thief Town is a multiplayer-only stealth action game set in a pixel-perfect rendition of the Wild West. Lurk in the crowd, emulate non-player characters, and achieve backstabbing victory. Up to 4 players control identical avatars (the “Thieves”) in a single-screen arena (the “Town”), which is filled with other identical NPCs. Players must identify which NPCs are secretly other players and stab them for points, before being discovered and stabbed themselves!

Features


Competitive 2-4 player battles: Try to blend in with thieves while finding and stabbing other players.
A multitude of modes: Guns, smoke bombs, sheriffs, drunks, sandstorms, and more await you.
LAN & Local dynamic play: Play over LAN with up to three other players, plug in controllers to play locally, or do any combination of the two!
Cross-platform play: Play on PC, Mac, Linux, Android, or iOS devices. Any device with Thief Town installed can connect to any other device!
No menus: Connecting to other players has never been this simple!


Source: The Publisher Website.

167892.description:
Gang Up! is casual card game where you compete to become the ultimate crime lord! Recruit legendary gang members and commit crazy daring crimes. Use criminal influences and team up with other players to get ahead. And when they least expect it, backstab them to win the game!

What's so good about Gang Up!?

Well...!


Constantly choose between helping or backstabbing friends!
Use weird card combos and advanced tactics
Always influence the game, even when it's not your turn!
Never get stuck at last place; we put you back in the race!
An overload of crazy criminals & crimes!
Beautiful artwork, no shabby back alley illustrations here.
And it's easy to learn & quick to play!


Version 1: Kickstarter edition (english, 2015)
verion 2; published by HOT Games (english, 2016) & Czacha Games (polish, 2017)
167892.name: Gang Up!

167893.description: A small promo expansion for ESSEN the Game. It adds two new things: an event token that cancels the release of a game at the show, and a fire drill event at the end of the game.
167893.name: ESSEN the Game: Goodies

167894.description: This upgrade kit contains the counters and game board to upgrade your copy of Antike to the new version. Only the cards need to be downloaded from the publisher's website.
167894.name: Antike II: Upgrade Kit

boardgamecompilation.178739: King of New York Promo Cards

167896.description:
The Improvised Weapons is a KEEP card that costs 3 energy.
For each Destruction die that you use to destroy Units, you deal 1 extra damage in your attacks.

Improvised Weapons is the second promo card, primarily meant for distribution via Organized Play.
167896.name: King of New York: Improvised Weapons

167897.description:
The 55 Central Park West is a DISCARD card that costs 4 energy.
Gain 2*. Reveal 1 card for each player and choose one. The Monster to you left chooses 1 of the remaining cards and so on, until each Monster gained 1 card.

The card is included in the Halloween Collector Pack for King of Tokyo.
167897.name: King of New York: 55 Central Park West

167898.name: 4ty4
167898.description:
A tactical Mancala variant. There are stones in three colors, and the board has some intersections where you can choose where to go with your move.
You can only move stacks with your own stone on top, and you score points if you manage to create three stacks next to each other with differently colored stones on top.

167899.description: A promo card for Among the Stars. It gives points for red locations in another player's station that you don't have.
167899.name: Among the Stars: Intelligence Agency

167900.description:
A promo card for New Dawn. It allows you to seize control of an adjacent facility.

This promo is included in New Dawn: Bonus Game Material (Kickstarter stretch rewards).
167900.name: New Dawn: U-Cannon

167901.name: Time Masters: Promo Cards
167901.description:
A set of three promo cards that were given out with purchase of the game at Essen 2014.

One card gives immunity from opponent spells, another makes opponent spells cost more, and the last one is a helpful effect that moves among the players.

This Timer is the last Timer to build the big picture of Time Masters. Indeed, build with the 12 Timers of Time Masters a picture who is the "symbole" of the game.

167902.description:
A set of 16 new cards for the game:


Crystallization x2
Permutation x2
Renunciation x2
Dismissal x2
Soul Exchange x2
Transposition x2
Omniscience x2
Echo x2
167902.name: Time Masters: Expansion

167903.description:
A set of small promo expansions in honour of the 20-year jubilee of Darmstadt Spielt. It was available at the event and can still (June 2015) be ordered via their homepage. This contains:

Hugo das Schlossgespenst: Gruselplättchen
Carcassonne: Darmstadt
Zooloretto: Langer Ludwig
Die Siedler von Catan: Hochzeitsturm
Village Port: Schatzkiste
167903.name: 20 Jahre Darmstadt Spielt

167904.name: Shadowrun 2050
167904.description:
From the English description of Shadowrun 2050

Rewind and Reload

Chrome eyes. Computers called “decks.” Big hair, big cyberlimbs and bigger guns. It’s Shadowrun in the year it all started. Take a step back to Shadowrun’s roots with Shadowrun 2050, a book that combines Fourth Edition rules—the smoothest, most accessible rule set Shadowrun has ever had—with the setting that first made the Sixth World a legend.

Shadowrun 2050 has everything players and gamemasters need to dive into the grimy beauty that kicked off one of the greatest roleplaying settings of all time. With information on how to adapt Fourth Edition Matrix, gear, and magic rules for the 2050 setting, as well as in-universe information about the powers of the world, what shadowrunners will be up to, and who they’ll be running into, Shadowrun 2050 puts a new twist on the classic setting.

Captain Chaos. Maria Mercurial. The Laughing Man. Sally Tsung. JetBlack. Hatchetman. Nightfire. And the Shadowland poster who just called himself The Big “D.” These people and many others are waiting for you in the year that started it all, a setting brought back to life with new, full-color artwork showing the chrome, dirt, neon, and darkness that was in the heart of Shadowrun when it started and remains at its core today.

German Version
The German version has been updated to use Shadowrun 5th edition rules. Furthermore, a new chapter is added detailing the events of the Dragonfall computer game.

this Shadowrun 2050 is for use with Shadowrun 5th Edition.

167905.name: Halloween Horrors (Capes, Cowls and Villains Foul)
167905.description:
From publisher blurb:

Superheros vs Super Horrors!

Halloween Horrors is a supplement for Capes, Cowls & Villains Foul that features 6 foes for your heroes to face Each foe creates fear in normals, so how will your heroes react when they encounter them?

From a creature out of folklore, to a spawn of a Cosmic Horror, there are not typical opponents heroes face.

Each creature features a journal entry from Xavier Stone, occult investigator, as well as background information and stats for each creature. In addition, each creature has a "Terror-Tastic Tidbit" which is a short adventure seed to help get starting using them right away.

There's also paper standees for all six creatures (and Xavier) you can print and use.

How will your hero fare? Will they do as always, and shine in the face of danger, or will they flee in terror from these things that go bump in the night?

167906.name: The Triad (Supers!)
167906.description:
From publisher blurb:

"In the criminal underworld, The Triad are known as a specialists in acquiring artifacts of a mystical nature for those willing to pay the right price. They've tangled with various super heroes (and some villains) over the years."

The Triad is the first in a series of villains for use with Supers!. This group specializes in stealing occult artifacts for the highest bidder, even those used by mystical heroes.

The book features information and stats on all 3 members of The Triad, as well as adventure seeds (one of which includes a fully statted NPC hero your players can interact with), and paper standees.

167907.name: Witches
167907.description:
From publisher blurb:

This edition of “Fantastic Feats” – a series of feats based around a certain theme or subject – is about Witches, those magic users who draw their magic from other worldly powers.

The feats you'll find inside:

Aura of Menace - The witch can capitlalise on the fear that some have for them
Familiar Power Booster - The familiar gives a slight boost to some spells
Patrons Blessing - The Witches patron can provide an extra bonus, but don't anger them!
Quick Learning Familiar - Your familiar can learn spells faster
Stable Witch Spells - Increased minimum damage on some spells at the cost of lower maximum damage
Stronger Hexes - Your hexes are cast at a level higher
Unstable Witch Spells - Any hex or spell with a random component is more chaotic

167908.name: Star Nomad
167908.description:
User Summary

Star Nomad is a top-down 2D RPG/RTS sandbox spacesim. You can choose between 6 different kinds of characters to play. It has multiple ship classes to fly, and all ships are up-gradable with modules.

boardgamecompilation.178571: Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Big Box: Kickstarter Edition

167909.description:
Queenie 5 for Escape. 3 new quest chambers (chaos chamber, constellation chamber and snake pit) and 3 new curses (mind control, pitfall and magical bond)

Chaos Chamber - All adventurers must be in this chamber at the same time and draw 1 curse each to complete this task.

Constellation Chamber - All players must be in the corresponding chambers and roll 2 keys to complete the task. A sixth player need not do anything to complete this task.
1: The Constellation Chamber
2: The Starting Chamber
3: A Triple Gem Chamber
4: A Single Gem Chamber
5: The Exit Chamber

Snake Pit - The player who discovers the snake pit takes 1 snake token for every other adventurer and adds them to each of their chambers. First all token snakes must be defeated with 2 torches while in the same chamber as the token. After that has been completed, players must defeat the mother snake in the chamber using 5 torches to complete this task.

Mind Control - You are not allowed to touch your adventurer figure, the draw pile, or gems on the depot. Other players must move them for you.

Pitfall - Immediately place your adventurer figure back in the starting chamber. Then discard this curse.

Magical Bond - You must have 1 hand touching another player at all times.
167909.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Quest Chambers

113294.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple

boardgamecompilation.178571: Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Big Box: Kickstarter Edition

167910.description:
Queenie 7 for Escape. 2 new chambers (dungeon, narrow gauge), 2 new treasures (portal, clone) and 2 new characters (void runner, trickster)

Dungeon - Players cannot get back through the entrance of this chamber.

Narrow Gauge - The Narrow Gauge has 4 entries. Roll 3 torches to get in and 3 torches to activate a gem. It also has a treasure if playing with treasures.

Portal - Place your adventurer in any adjacent chamber - even diagonal.

Clone - Double all key and torch symbol for one action.

Void Runner:
Permanent - You may travel through an open doorway to another open doorway anywhere on the board with 2 rolled adventurers.
Activatable - You may take all adventurers in your chamber with you.

Trickster:
Permanent - You may physically exchange (1 to 1) any amount of dice with another player in your chamber.
Activatable - You may physically exchange (1 to 1) any amount of dice with another player in any chamber.
167910.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple – New Characters

113294.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple

boardgamecompilation.178571: Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Big Box: Kickstarter Edition

167911.description:
Queenie 6 for Escape. 2 new chambers (mirage chamber, gear chamber), 2 new curses (weakest link, misinformation), 3 new treasures (short cut, time out, genie lamp)

Mirage Chamber - When the Mirage Chamber is revealed, it replaces the Starting Chamber and the Starting Chamber is placed where the Mirage Chamber would have gone.

Gear Chamber - While in the chamber, players must roll 2 torches to slide 1 row or column of chamber tiles 1 space in one direction. All chambers in the row or column must move.

Weakest Link - If you aren't back in the start chamber at the end of the countdown then you all lose the game. This curse can't be lifted.

Misinformation - Every time you discover a new chamber you have to yell "I found the exit" twice.

Short Cut - When discovering a new chamber, look through the whole draw pile and choose 1. Reshuffle when finished.

Time Out - Use to pause the timer/soundtrack and plan. No rolling while paused.

Genie Lamp - Draw the top 3 treasures from the stack and choose 1. Return the others to the bottom.
167911.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple – The Maze

113294.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple

167914.name: Arrowdown

rpghonor.27863: 2015 ENnie for Best Free Product - Nominee

167914.description:
From publisher blurb:

Arrowdown is a free introduction scenario for Doctor Who Adventures in Time and Space. An unexploded bomb in the coastal village of Arrowdown opens the door to a much more terrifying mystery and a deadly adversary.

Arrowdown is intended to be a fast moving scenario to guide you through the way the game works, give each type of character a chance to shine and at the same time emphasise exactly how strange and dangerous the Doctor’s world is. There are several elements of the scenario that can go more than one way depending on what type of group you’re playing with, and the various different takes on events are explored as they come up.

167916.name: Death Frost Doom (Revised)
167916.description:
Publisher's blurb:

There is a curse laid on everything in that place! Cursed, you hear me? Cursed!

Up on the mountain is a house by a cemetery, haunted by the memories of atrocities past. The cult on the mountain is long gone, yet the music of weirdling death carries on the wind.

The mountain is cold. So very cold.

And the greedy and the foolish will march bravely up the mountain for gold and glory.

…but are they worth your soul?

You Are Doomed

Death Frost Doom is the adventure that launched Lamentations of the Flame Princess in 2009, and this anniversary edition has been fully revised by Zak S—of A Red & Pleasant Land and Vornheim: The Complete City Kit fame—with all new interior artwork by Jez Gordon.

An adventure suitable for low-level characters for use with Lamentations of the Flame Princess and other traditional role-playing games.

167917.description:
Expansion to Takamatsu

The green pagoda is placed on the lowest Shogun beside the game board, doubling the value of that card.
167917.name: Takamatsu: The green pagoda

167918.name: Fighter Hangar
167918.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 224th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a hangar for fighter drones aboard a spaceship.

The map is 21 x 20 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 6 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2880x3024 pixels in size at 144dpi.

167919.description:
The green Samurai - a loner - of the game is placed at the beginning of the game in the room with the value +2.
The green Samurai effectively blocks a room so that it cannot be entered.
It automatically moves to the next free room.
167919.name: Takamatsu: The green Samurai

167920.name: Friends & Foes
167920.description:
A Fantasy Team Brawler Board Game. Play as one of seven unique characters in this exciting, easy to learn game of fantasy combat.

Guided by modern game design principles:

No Player Elimination
Simultaneous Turns
One Hour Play Time
Easy to Learn and Teach
Deep Strategies




Game Play Highlights:


Play on teams and use teamwork and strategy in head to head combat.
Draft characters or deal them randomly.
Build your character by choosing your abilities before the game starts.
Play one ability per turn, simultaneously. You have access to all of your abilities every turn.
Gain and spend "focus" using your ability cards.
Reveal rune cards for bonus effects on the ability you play.
Play a "level up" ability to add a wild card to your rune deck, giving you better odds on bonus effects for the rest of the game.
Move and attack using your ability cards.
Make meaningful choices about how to spend focus such as:
Tactical Movement
Fast, high damage attacks
Level up for a late game strategy

167921.name: Clocks: "Silver" Dice
167921.description:
Two extra dice, silver plated, limited to 200 sets, with the following rules:
"Yellow dice increase the tension in the auction: You can replace the yellow dice with the metal-plated dice and add both of the yellow dice to the bag at the beginning of the game.
This is only recommended with 3 or 4 players.
When a yellow die is pulled out of the bag, it is immediately removed from the game.
Therfore, for each yellow die pulled from the bag, there will be one less group of dice created for that particular auction (and two groups fewer if the two yellow dice come out at the same time).

There also are sets of 2 "Copper" dice, limited to 300, and sets of "Aluminum", limited to 400.

167923.name: Champion Path Abilities II
167923.description:
From publisher blurb:

Champion Path Abilities II brings you 14 brand-new mythic path abilities for the Champion path, from the powers to ensure a legacy of vengeance like Ancestral Arms and Blood Oath to devastating combat tricks like To the Victor and Stunning Shockwave!

167924.name: World War II Archetypes

rpgseries.24608: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters

167924.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you play Savage Worlds, then you know their slogan: "Fast, Furious, and Fun!" And if you play any role-playing game, you know it's all to easy to get stuck generating characters, filling out record sheets and otherwise doing paperwork. Sometimes you just want to sit down and play. Sometimes you need the characters already waiting.

Sometimes you need a Cast of Cards.

Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

About Cast of Cards: World War II Archetypes (Modern)

Is your player group taking on missions during World War II? These 17 Savage Worlds archetypes give you NPCs, allies and enemies that you might encounter on the battlefields!

167925.name: Big Time Hoops
167925.description:
Big Time Hoops is a fast-playing, card-based simulation of professional basketball for two players. To recreate the flow of the game and remove "housekeeping" altogether, the game eschews individual cards for basketball players and focuses exclusively on the major action elements of the sport.

In general, you'll hold a hand of three cards, most of which will be offensive in nature. You'll play one of them, choosing to pass the ball or drive to the basket; each card will result in a shot attempt with a varying degree of success. Then you'll roll a die. If the shot fails, the card states which side gets the rebound. (Yes, three-point shots are in the game.)

Your opponent can play a defensive card, and when used wisely he'll steal a pass, block a shot or foul your shooter.

Simulating realistic scoring requires a delicate balance in a sport where each team averages 100 points per game. Rest assured that you'll find it here, as the number of two-pointers, three-pointers and foul shots will be very close to their actual real-life averages each and every game.

Playable in an hour, Big Time Hoops will provide all the fun and excitement of real pro basketball -- without the high ticket prices!

167926.name: WWII: Stavka Spetsnaz Otryad (Soviet Special Forces)

rpgseries.24608: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters

167926.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you play Savage Worlds, then you know their slogan: "Fast, Furious, and Fun!" And if you play any role-playing game, you know it's all to easy to get stuck generating characters, filling out record sheets and otherwise doing paperwork. Sometimes you just want to sit down and play. Sometimes you need the characters already waiting.

Sometimes you need a Cast of Cards.

Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

About Cast of Cards: WWII Soviet Special Forces

During World War II, every nation had a group of soldiers with very special talents, the Soviets included. These aren't your run-of-the-mill specially trained troopers, though. Each member brings unique advantages to the battlefield—along with an undying loyalty to Mother Russia.

167927.name: Arcane Carnival

rpgseries.24608: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters

167927.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you play Savage Worlds, then you know their slogan: "Fast, Furious, and Fun!" And if you play any role-playing game, you know it's all to easy to get stuck generating characters, filling out record sheets and otherwise doing paperwork. Sometimes you just want to sit down and play. Sometimes you need the characters already waiting.

Sometimes you need a Cast of Cards.

Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

About Cast of Cards: Arcane Carnival (Modern)

The grand carnival came to town, but something isn't sitting right. No one is sure where it came from or why it won't leave. It's time for your player group to buy some tickets and get to the bottom of this mystery!

167928.name: Robot City Archetypes

rpgseries.24608: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters

167928.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you play Savage Worlds, then you know their slogan: "Fast, Furious, and Fun!" And if you play any role-playing game, you know it's all to easy to get stuck generating characters, filling out record sheets and otherwise doing paperwork. Sometimes you just want to sit down and play. Sometimes you need the characters already waiting.

Sometimes you need a Cast of Cards.

Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

About Cast of Cards: Robot City Archetypes

Robots are a part of daily life in the future, filling all kinds of roles from truck driver to military commando. If you're heading to the big city, here's 17 robots based on Archetypes presented in Savage Worlds Deluxe!

167929.name: Fields of Gore
167929.description:
In the world of Lyzarbhy the magic, chaos and the adventure welcomes you !

Fields of Gore is the introductory set for FOG game system edition. It is a basic set game containing forces of Orcs and Undead with a small rulebook, scenario book, paper templates, paper models, paper miniatures necessary to play. Set during The Great Orcoid Wars in the world of Lyzarbhi.

This PNP set contains two starter armies plus a scenario, player aids and redux rules of FOG system.

Players take command of each force, fighting a sample scenario and the rulebook have rules for create another ones, with a simplified points system.

With a rich lore and a lot of fluff, the game give to the players lot of fun without tons of rules.

167930.description:
A new, official, Ancient One card, given to attendees of the Arkham Nights event held on 17-18 October 2014.

Consists of The Dark God, a new Ancient One.
167930.name: Elder Sign: Arkham Nights 2014 Promotional Ancient One Card

167931.name: OWWW
167931.description:
User Summary

A spoof on VVVVVV, this time set in the designer Terry Cavanaugh's mouth. Retro pixel graphics, still flip the screen. But this time there are things on the screen moving past (bacteria I presume) and if you hit them you can go for a ride. This game is super hard, just like VVVVVV.

What is in a tooth? It is a grand mystery that might be too painful to investigate! But you must investigate??? Be a good friend in Terry Cavanagh’s mouth! BROWSER

Source: The Game Website.

167932.name: Spin Spin Episode 1
167932.description:
Spin Spin combines aspects of two gravity-defying platformer games to create a fresh experience. The world spinning mechanic of And Yet It Moves is combined with the frantic pace and style of VVVVVV. By allowing only one spin at a time, the world spinning mechanic is expanded in new and unique ways.

Source: The Game Website.

167933.name: Spin Spin Episode 2
167933.description:
Spin Spin combines aspects of two gravity-defying platformer games to create a fresh experience. The world spinning mechanic of And Yet It Moves is combined with the frantic pace and style of VVVVVV. By allowing only one spin at a time, the world spinning mechanic is expanded in new and unique ways.

Source: The Game Website.

167934.name: Electric Tortoise
167934.description:
User Summary

The game puts you in the role of a detective who is interviewing a robot about the murder of it's master. Select from the dialog options to choose the path of the conversation and immerse yourself in this I, Robot and Blade Runner inspired game.

167935.name: The Domovoi
167935.description:
User Summary

A story teller is weaving you a story. Trying to work out how it should go. The theme is of a Domovoi which is a a hairy housedwelling creature of Slavic folklore.
